/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|                        The Lineages of Avendar                           |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/
/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
| Human:     Gregarious and flexible, known as great empire-builders.      |
| Aelin:     Slight with feathered wings, known for their grace and pride. |
| Alatharya: Giants with silvery skin, the First People cannot use magic.  |
| Caladaran: Sagely, tree-like people famed for their monastic traditions. |
| Chaja:     Caprine and reclusive giants with wooly hair and small horns. |
| Ch'taren:  Curious and alien beings the golden hue of their auras.       |
| Ethron:    Small, amphibious plant-loving people with colourful skin.    |
| Nefortu:   Chiropteran people known for their cunning and alacrity.      |
| Shuddeni:  Eyeless subterranean marsupials connected to demonkind.       |
| Srryn:     Bipedal reptiles known for adaptability and territoriality.   |
|                                                                          |
| All lineages are physically humanoid but different species. Hybrids do   |
| not exist. All characters roll up at the age of mental and physical      |
| maturity for their lineage, which may vary between species.              |
|                                                                          |
| Each lineage will have different innate traits (such as flight or        |
| darkvision) and a different spread of maximum statistics. For more       |
| information, including a table of max stats, see HELP STATISTICS.        |

Select your lineage (help for more information)? [Hit Return to continue]
chaja
chaja
/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|                                  Chaja                                   |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/
/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
| Most chaja communities live in isolated strongholds in the Brintor       |
| mountains, ordering their lives by the stars.  Owing to this isolation,  |
| chaja are most widely known across Avendar for their use by the shuddeni |
| as slaves, particularly during the War of Night.  Chaja are caprine      |
| giants with wooly hair covering most of their bodies, uniformly pale     |
| eyes, and small, nubby horns.  They are nearly as tall as the alatharya, |
| but have rounder, softer bodies with little muscle definition.  Their    |
| size allows them to wield two-handed weapons in a single hand.  They     |
| can see in darkness, and may safely eat nearly anything.  For more       |
| information, read HELP CHAJA.                                            |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Are you sure this is the lineage you wish to choose?

/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|                        The Professions of Avendar                        |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/
/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
| Warriors:    Uses brute force or combat expertise to their advange.      |
|              Includes fighters, swordmasters, and gladiators.            |
| Rogues:      Rely on stealth, concealment, and cunning to achieve their  |
|              goals. Includes thieves, bandits, and bards.                |
| Scholars:    Mages who are schooled in elemental magic. They may study   |
|              the spheres of Fire, Water, Earth, Air, Spirit, or Void.    |
| Templars:    Spellswords who forgo mastery to blend their talents. They  |
|              study one of the six elemental spheres.                     |
| Naturalists: Devotees of the wild who are strongest outdoors. Includes   |
|              rangers, barbarians, and druids.                            |
| Mentalists:  Disciples of the mind who learn psionic abilities. Includes |
|              assassins, watchers, and psionicists.                       |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Select an available profession from those listed below.
 [Scholar Templar Rogue Warrior Naturalist Mentalist ]: 
warrior

/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|                              Warrior Classes                             |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/
/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
| Fighter:     Soldiers and mercenaries trained by one of Avendar's city   |
|              militias, who focus on formations and phalanxes.            |
| Swordmaster: Students of the ancient ak'anginta, they devote themselves  |
|              entirely to the sword, becoming their unrivaled masters.    |
| Gladiator:   Pit-fighters trained in showy combat techniques, they are   |
|              as charismatic as they are deadly.                          |

|                             Trait Selection                              |

/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
| Traits represent unusual abilities, training, or expertise in a niche    |
| area.  Many classes automatically receive one or more traits for free    |
| during creation, which represents part of your character's training      |
| during their time in the School of Heroes.                               |
|                                                                          |
| You have five total points to spend on traits. Religion and god touch    |
| is the last step in character creation; please remember to keep 3 of     |
| your trait points if you desire a god touch. For a mechanical breakdown  |
| of each, please see HELP TRAITS and HELP GOD TOUCH.                      |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/

background

The following background traits are available:

aristocrat: When you have matured some, you will be granted an inheritance from your estate. (2
trains)
weapon maintenance: You are trained to repair metal weapons when they are damaged. (1 train)
streetwise: A life spent growing up on the streets has left you wise to many common tricks. (2
trains)
thieves cant: You know the silent hand signal language of thieves. (1 train)
mortician: You are quite skilled at dismembering and dissecting corpses. (1 train)
loremaster: You have studied extensively, and have a mastery of rare lore and esoterica. (1 train)
forger: You have studied and practiced various methods of forgery. (1 train)

Welcome!  If you are new to MUDs, you may want to read "help starting".  

The Beginning
  The School of Heroes is hidden in a remote valley in the Yagash
Mountains, and the cold bite of high elevation swirls around you under a
perpetually overcast sky.  Gilded symbols of the gods Dolgrael, Lilune, and
Jolinn have been lovingly sculpted into massive doors of dark basalt that
lock fast behind you.  There is no way back; only forward.  

Whether due to triumph or tragedy, a drive to desperate heroism or sadistic
villainy, you have come to this remote place and secured your adventurer's
license from the School of Heroes.  You have completed your official
training and registration and stand now before the Tower of Testing, where
your final practical examinations await you.  

You may leave through the portals connected to different towns on the
continent of Avendar in the Tower of Testing ahead, but you are encouraged
to proceed with your practical examination, as it will impart many valuable
skills and items for your life ahead.  

[OOC: Welcome to Avendar!  You may type HELP to access our help system
and the NEWBIE channel is available to request out-of-character
assistance from staff or other players.]

[Exits: north]
Type "newbie" if you wish to enable the global new players channel.

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Before the Gates of the School of Heroes
  Before you stand the gates of the School of Heroes, the renowned center
of training for young adventurers.  It is an enormous structure, composed of
marble, stone, and brick, and has been built upon a rocky hill.  The gates
are forged of wrought iron, and remain open to travelers of every size,
affiliation, and creed.  The central foyer of the School lies ahead, the
marble edifice looming over its well-worn gates.  A small courtyard opens
here, with a beautiful central fountain and a circle of low bushes.  

[Exits: north south]
     A beautiful golden fountain gushes water.

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Inside the Gates
  Past the wrought iron gates is a wide corridor with walls cut from solid
granite blocks, lit by mounted white globes.  The entry corridor is
surprisingly simple for such a vast and well-known establishment, as it
bears no notable ornamentation.  The School's foyer awaits to the north,
opening up from the corridor's enclosure into a vast chamber.  To the south
lies the School's entrance.  

[Exits: north south]
(White Aura) An aging gate guard stands here, welcoming new arrivals.
Arafis Tindel says, 'Welcome to the School of Heroes.'
Arafis Tindel bows deeply.

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Foyer of the School of Heroes
  The School of Heroes begins with a grand foyer, complete with a vaulted
ceiling held aloft by great marble columns.  The room is spacious and airy,
with high, white marble walls and mounted, shining globes to provide light. 
Two great marble stairways sit back, just off center toward the room's north
side.  One ascends to an upper level of the School, and spirals about a
great glass pillar as it rises.  A well-made desk sits not far from the
foyer's entrance, giving the receptionist an opportunity to greet new
students.  The other descends to a lower level, and voices echo from its
depths.  Three halls open to the north, east, and west, leading to other
branches of the School.  The corridor to the south leads to the School's
iron gates.  

A large sign sits off to one side, offering directions to students.

[Exits: north east south west up down]
(!) A mossy-haired caladaran woman sits at the reception desk.
Jimacha tells you, 'Khuruin, my name is Jimacha.  May the gods bless you with reason.'
Jimacha tells you, 'The School of Heroes is meant to teach you the skills required for adventuring.'
Jimacha tells you, 'You should explore its sections thoroughly before you proceed to the Tower of
Testing.'
Jimacha tells you, 'Make sure you are armed and proceed with caution-- the Tower is full of
monsters!'
Jimacha tells you, 'If you ascend it successfully, you will be rewarded with the School sigil.'
Jimacha tells you, 'With it, you should feel ready to explore Avendar at large.'
This task must be completed before reaching level 11.

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Portal Chamber
  This cubical room is made from blocks of hewn marble.  Benches of similar
stone are set diagonally against the corners of the room, and an open
skylight provides illumination from above.  However, this room is unique in
that it contains four magical gateways which connect the School of Heroes to
various locations in Avendar.  Each glowing with soft blue light, the three
vertical portals are set into the eastern, western, and southern walls.  The
fourth portal is horizontal and circular, and is set into the floor directly
beneath the skylight.  A more mundane doorway leads north, to the courtyard
before the entrance to the School proper.  

[Exits: north east south west down]
(Translucent) A magic mouth hovers in mid-air, grinning nonchalantly.
The magic mouth tells you, 'Are you sure you're ready to leave the School?'
The magic mouth tells you, 'If you're ready, then you're ready...'
The magic mouth tells you, 'If you want to know about the portal destinations, say the name of the
direction you want to go.'

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Office of Applied Theology
  The office exudes an air of cold formality, dominated by sleek white
marble walls and polished floors that reflect the bright light of hanging
magelights.  The western wall features an expansive mural depicting the
liberation of Var Bandor, set before a wide, heavy desk.  The environment
feels almost sterile, both imposing and inescapable despite the large double
doors perpetually open to Dantaron street.  

[Exits: north east south down]
(White Aura) Nistaru stands behind the desk, sneering at petitioners.

Dantaron Street
  Dantaron Street bisects the west half of Var Bandor, leading from Center
Square to the docks outside the western gatehouse.  Sailors and dockmen
abound in this section of the city, wandering the streets while off-duty. 
The street is composed of well-worn cobblestones, with a few broken and
missing.  To the north, a large temple constructed of fine white marble
rises over the street.  To the south is a traveller's inn.

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A bedraggled orange tabby cat with a tattered ear and a mournful expression is here.
     A large marble fountain gurgles peacefully here.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Ilrin Street
  A wide street composed of black stones and carefully-arranged curbs,
Ilrin Street runs the length of southern Var Bandor, winding among the
gloriously rich houses of the merchants and the eccentrically constructed
towers of the scholars.  Here and there, baskets of flowers hang from the
sides of buildings, and hired servants tend to shaped shrubs.  The streets
in the southern part of town are swept clean, and all animal traffic is
prohibited.  The Var Bandor Center Square is to the north.  

[Exits: north south]
Bromrin, alatharyan Captain of Var Bandor law enforcement, patrols here.

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Lifalin's Bows
  Lifalin's shop is completed devoted to the craft of archery.  Bows of
stout ash are interspersed with those made from lighter yew.  Along with the
bows, several finely tooled leather quivers hold arrows of several different
varieties, all neatly arranged and fletched with light brown feathers.  The
shop has few places to sit, aside from a small chair behind the counter. 
The only exit lies to the north, onto Dantaron Street.  

[Exits: north]
Lifalin works quietly on stringing a bow.

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Journey's End
  The Journey's End is a nice inn, though with closer examination you note
cobwebs that would not be present if this inn were in a more reputable part
of town.  A small bar stands in one corner, but most of the hard core
drinkers will go to one of the other numerous pubs along the road.  The
innkeeper stands behind the bar, accepting coin for his rooms upstairs, and
for food and drink alike.  The inn continues to the south, with more tables
for customers to sit down and relax, and there is a small door behind the
bar leading to the innkeeper's personal room.  North is the door back to the
bustle of Dantaron Road.  

[Exits: north (east) south]
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor patrols here.
The innkeeper bustles around the room, a warm welcoming smile on his round face.
A woman sits here, enjoying the peace of the inn.
A patron of the inn sits here, enjoying a fine meal.
A young boy sits here, spinning a brightly coloured top.

The Boatseller's
  The boatsellers shop is big out of necessity, the boats out for people to
buy taking up a large amount of space.  The shop seems in good repair, and
the boats you can examine are all well put together, and seem like quality
workmanship.  The only exit is to the north, where the Dantaron Road runs
along.

Sadrent Road
  Sadrent Road runs the length of northern Var Bandor, winding its way
through the worst parts of town.  Built on the delta when Var Bandor was
founded, the northern buildings are the oldest, and consequently have become
the slum area.  Sadrent Road itself is a wide band of filthy cobblestones
winding between the ruined buildings.  To the south is the central square of
Var Bandor.

founded, the northern buildings are the oldest, and consequently have become
the slum area.  Sadrent Road itself is a wide band of filthy cobblestones
winding between the ruined buildings.  To the east, Dretch street leads into
the most notorious neighborhoods of Var Bandor.

Inside the Northern Gatehouse

Cost: 1 train

Some individuals sleep particularly lightly, and are particularly sensitive to

informed when anyone they are able to detect enters or leaves the room, or
when someone speaks.

North Wall of the Temple of Darkness
  Earendam's temple of darkness is an architectural hybrid, blending the
classical Republican forms with the statuery of Yithoul and the intricate
carvings of the Srryn.  The temple is topped by a barrel-vaulted roof, which
leads from the southern entrance towards the altar which sits here against
the north wall.  Supporting the ceiling are a series of onyx columns, whose
intricate carvings serve to frame a set of statues in marble, forming a sort
of gallery along the east and west walls.  The altar here is made from
carved ebony, cunningly crafted with the symbols of the order which tends
this temple.  Set on the altar are smoldering censers, which fill the
surrounding air with the smell of myrrh.

The Portal Chamber
  This cubical room is made from blocks of hewn marble.  Benches of similar
stone are set diagonally against the corners of the room, and an open
skylight provides illumination from above.  However, this room is unique in
that it contains four magical gateways which connect the School of Heroes to
various locations in Avendar.  Each glowing with soft blue light, the three
vertical portals are set into the eastern, western, and southern walls.  The
fourth portal is horizontal and circular, and is set into the floor directly
beneath the skylight.  A more mundane doorway leads north, to the courtyard
before the entrance to the School proper.

Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is

and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for

the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.

<175hp 124m 81mv> 
help chaja
/---------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|          Chaja (Spell)                                                    |
\---------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Activation lag  :  2.0 rounds
Activation cost :  0 mana

The chaja were the first lineage to settle the Brintor mountains,
building many great towering stone spires in homage to their starry goddess,
Kyana.  In obeisance to her foresight, they retreated underground enmasse,
establishing isolated strongholds within the mountains.  Soon after their
exodus, the aelin would settle in their former homes, mistaking their
majestic spires for alatharyan ruins; they would be scoured to dust within
centuries by the War of Fire.  

Chaja are now a largely subterranean people within the Brintors, their
mastery of the druidic arts transforming their underground caverns into
sunlit, verdant spaces.  The influences of the gods Elanthe and Kurion
alongside Kyana have made them a stoic people .  Owing to their isolation,
chaja are known outside the mountains for their frequent use as slaves by
the shuddeni, particularly during the War of Night when they were forced to
be shock troops.  The shuddeni continue to predate upon the chaja,
kidnapping them for enslavement as laborers, hunters, or servants.  Crude
stereotypes and lingering prejudice have made chaja lives in outside cities
such as Earendam or Ashta Harrud frustrating ones.  They can frequently be
found commiserating with alatharya, who experience similar prejudices.  

Ranging between six and eight feet tall, chaja are quite stout and vaguely
caprine in appearance, with flat noses and small blunt horns often hidden in
their thick, wooly hair ranging in colour from cream to brown to black. 
They are quite hirsute, often growing mantles of long shaggy hair across
their shoulders, chest, and back, and both sexes may grow beards.  Young
chaja have much lighter hair and skin that darkens with age, and their eyes
are either colourless or very pale, without a visible pupil or sclera.  The
lingering blessing of Kyana allows chaja to see perfectly in darkness, and
they can eat almost anything without ill effect.  Their stature allows them
to wield two-handed weapons in one hand.  

See also: STATISTICS

<175hp 124m 149mv> 
help cross
/---------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|          Cross (Skill)                                                    |
\---------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Activation lag  :  2.0 rounds
Activation cost :  20 mana


Syntax: Cross

Gladiators wielding a weapon (srryn or kankoran claws will also suffice) are
able to step close to their opponents in combat, crossing weapons with them.
They can then take advantage of this to sharply knee their opponent, dealing
bash damage and potentially lagging them.


See also: LAG

<175hp 124m 149mv> 
help whirl
/---------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|          Whirl (Skill)                                                    |
\---------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Activation lag  :  1.5 rounds
Activation cost :  15 mana


Syntax: Whirl

A gladiator wielding any weapon (or one's own natural claws) may lash out in a
whirling blow, slamming it through everyone else nearby, dealing damage.


See also: KASLAUG'S VIGOR, CYCLONE

<175hp 124m 149mv> 

The wind picks up, blowing from the north.

<175hp 124m 149mv> 
help knee shatter
/---------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|          Knee Shatter (Skill)                                             |
\---------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Activation lag  :  2.0 rounds
Activation cost :  15 mana


Syntax: Kick

Bandits and gladiators, both comfortable with using dirty tricks in combat,
are able to shatter their opponent's knee when they kick at them. It is more
difficult to shatter the knee of someone whose skin is protected by the stone
skin or stone shell spells. Characters who have a shattered knee will have
markedly reduced dexterity, will be slowed if they walk, and consume extra
movement points when they do walk. Flying will naturally obviate the latter
two penalties, but the first will still apply. Someone with a shattered knee
will have a much harder time kicking people themselves.


See also: KICK

North Wall of the Temple of Darkness
  Earendam's temple of darkness is an architectural hybrid, blending the
classical Republican forms with the statuery of Yithoul and the intricate
carvings of the Srryn.  The temple is topped by a barrel-vaulted roof, which
leads from the southern entrance towards the altar which sits here against
the north wall.  Supporting the ceiling are a series of onyx columns, whose
intricate carvings serve to frame a set of statues in marble, forming a sort
of gallery along the east and west walls.  The altar here is made from
carved ebony, cunningly crafted with the symbols of the order which tends
this temple.  Set on the altar are smoldering censers, which fill the
surrounding air with the smell of myrrh.

The Portal Chamber
  This cubical room is made from blocks of hewn marble.  Benches of similar
stone are set diagonally against the corners of the room, and an open
skylight provides illumination from above.  However, this room is unique in
that it contains four magical gateways which connect the School of Heroes to
various locations in Avendar.  Each glowing with soft blue light, the three
vertical portals are set into the eastern, western, and southern walls.  The
fourth portal is horizontal and circular, and is set into the floor directly
beneath the skylight.  A more mundane doorway leads north, to the courtyard
before the entrance to the School proper.

Ilrin Street
  A wide street composed of black stones and carefully-arranged curbs,
Ilrin Street runs the length of southern Var Bandor, winding among the
gloriously rich houses of the merchants and the eccentrically constructed
towers of the scholars.  Here and there, baskets of flowers hang from the
sides of buildings, and hired servants tend to shaped shrubs.  The streets
in the southern part of town are swept clean, and all animal traffic is
prohibited.

The Armorer
  The sounds of a hammer ringing as it strikes a piece of iron is the first
thing that assaults your ears as you enter the store.  You can also hear the
whishing of the bellows as it blows into the furnace to increase the heat of

The Bank of Var Bandor
  The most noticeable feature in the Bank is the line of teller windows
along the far wall.  The keen eyes of bankers peer out from behind the

<175hp 124m 44mv> 
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A bedraggled orange tabby cat with a tattered ear and a mournful expression is here.

Bromrin, alatharyan Captain of Var Bandor law enforcement, patrols here.
A grey pigeon walks about tentatively, looking for scraps of food.

Ilrin Street
  A wide street composed of black stones and carefully-arranged curbs,
Ilrin Street runs the length of southern Var Bandor, winding among the
gloriously rich houses of the merchants and the eccentrically constructed
towers of the scholars.  Here and there, baskets of flowers hang from the
sides of buildings, and hired servants tend to shaped shrubs.  The streets
in the southern part of town are swept clean, and all animal traffic is
prohibited.  To the east, Arcanos Street winds among the scholars' towers,
and to the west Commerce Street leads to the merchant quarter.

Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.

Iron Street
  Iron street is in a working class part of Var Bandor, and is far from
being one of the nicer areas in the city.  Men walk about along the street
going about their business, and few seem to notice you here.  Some small,
cramped houses line the streets between the larger warehouses, and some
children wearing ragged clothes can be seen playing outdoors.  The people
here do not seem as happy as those in the nicer parts of the city--a faint
air of oppression hangs over the working class folk of Iron Street.  To the
east is Sadrent Road.

Raddin Street
  Raddin Street, named after an ancient hero from the War of Fire, wends
its way east and west through Var Bandor.  Once a thriving part of town
known for its reputation as a home for men of action, it now serves as the
stomping ground for Var Bandor's cheaper hired swords.  A carved shield
marks the door of an armory to the north, while a hanging sign emblazoned
with a sword calls attention to the weapon shop to the south.  Raddin street
continues to the east, while the main drag of Sadrent road opens to the
west.

A Run-Down Weaponry
  This small store is particularly cramped and showing of age.  The ceiling
is cracked across the center, and the paint and plaster look aged and in
some need of repair.  Despite this, examples of the shop's unusual wares
hang along the walls on display, made primarily of wood and iron.  Weapons
of all types are arrayed throughout the shop, leaning or mounted.  The floor
is worn and rickety, and the shop's main counter is battered and worn from
years of sales.  Smaller work can be done in a small kiln in the back room,
but that seems more for repairs or modifications than to create the massive
wares the shop sells.  Raddin Street lies through the door to the north.  

[Exits: north]
A grizzled, scarred alatharya works within the shop.

The Saurian Armory
  This armory is unusually hot, presumably both because of the kiln against
the shop's north wall, and because of the tastes of its clientele.  An anvil
sits prominently near it, with a variety of tools stewn haphazardly about
the room.  Examples of the shop's unique wares hang from the walls, the
mounted skull-masks and intricately carved metal plates leering from the
aging walls.  Various hide and bone fetishes serve as the room's only other
apparent decorations, giving the entire affair a far more barbarous feel. 
The floor is marked by small scorches, where still-hot metal made a lasting
impression upon it.  To the south is Raddin Street, and the far cooler air
of the city.

A Dingy Office
  This one-room office is small and hopelessly seedy.  Dirty grey plaster
is cracked and bubbled in many places, stains and discolorations covering
the surface.  The roofbeams sag wearily, and the creaky floor is bowed and
warped.  Equally flimsy chairs are lined against the eastern wall.  The room
smells of damp and mold, and apparently hasn't been cleaned in years.  A
high desk, built to eliminate the need for a stool, sits opposite the
chairs.  An incredibly grimy window is made of dozens of thick, blurry panes
of cheap glass.  The window admits slightly less light than the open doorway
beside it which leads north out of the room.

The Tipsy Swordmaster
  The Tipsy Swordmaster is a tavern frequented by the less wealthy
mercenary classes of Var Bandor.  Filled with thick smoke from tobacco
pipes, the large common room of the tavern is filled with the loud sounds of

<196hp 132m 55mv> 
Raddin Street
  Raddin Street, named after an ancient hero from the War of Fire, wends
its way east and west through Var Bandor.  Once a thriving part of town
known for its reputation as a home for men of action, it now serves as the
stomping ground for Var Bandor's cheaper hired swords.  Raddin Street
deadends at a stone wall to the east, and returns to the west.  North is a
run-down flophouse, and a large tavern to the south is decorated with a sign
proclaiming it to be the Tipsy Swordmaster.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A battered and scarred gladiator guards the entrance to the tavern.

<196hp 132m 52mv> 
Sadrent Road
  Sadrent Road runs the length of northern Var Bandor, winding its way
through the worst parts of town.  Built on the delta when Var Bandor was
founded, the northern buildings are the oldest, and consequently have become
the slum area.  Sadrent Road itself is a wide band of filthy cobblestones
winding between the ruined buildings.  To the west, Iron Street leads into
the industrial section of Var Bandor, and to the east, Raddin street winds
through some run-down buildings.

Inside the Northern Gatehouse
  This gatehouse house is built behind the gates of Sadrent, the oldest of
the gates into Var Bandor.  Outside, to the north, a ferry leads across the
Dantaron river, while to the south Sadrent road snakes its way into the
city.  The gatehouse is ill-tended, leading in to the poorest section of the
city, and consequently little attention is paid to the traffic of riff-raff
and n'er-do-wells through these wrought iron gates.  

[Exits: north south]
A soldier of the Var Bandor Guard watches the gatehouse.

Outside the Northern Gatehouse
  The towering gates of Var Bandor rise to the south.  Huge, heavy wooden
doors reinforced with iron bars, the gates are maintained rigorously.  The
walls to the east and west are solid stone, with murder slits.  To the
north, the river Dantaron splits into two mighty forks which flow by Var
Bandor on either side.

The Outskirts of Var Bandor
  You stand outside the north wall of Var Bandor.  In the distance to the

growing. Behind you to the south, the stone wall of the city overshadows

The Arien Plains
  The flat Arien Plains stretch before you, gray, vast and unchanging. 
Small shrubs grow here and there, surrounded by patches of dry grass, but
for the most part the Plains are unvegetated.  To the north, the Arien Road
travels between Var Bandor and Earendam.  Immediately east, the docks of
Earendam bustle with activity.

The Earendam Docks
  A wide wooden docks has been erected just to the north of the River
Dantaron, flowing sluggishly to the south under the city wall.  The docks
are clear of clutter, incoming cargo being regulated closely and required to
move immediately.  An occasional raft or barge can be seen on the river,
arriving or leaving the city.  Several ladders and wooden walkways lead
downward to the water of the river itself.

The West Gate of Earendam
  Earendam's west gates are made of sturdy iron, built between two tall
stone pillars.  Reinforcing these gates are several stout bars of iron,
treated to preserve them from wear.  Outside the gates, the Arien Road heads

Arien Plaza opens, marking the beginning of Earendam proper.

The Earendam Road
  A narrow strip of stones that leads north into the grasslands, the
Earendam Road was once heavily travelled by caravans trading with the
mountain outposts to the north.  It has since fallen into disuse, but is
still nominally maintained by Earendam.

<197hp 132m 7mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The North Gates of Earendam
  Earendam's north gates are forged from black iron, built between the
stone walls of the city.  Reinforced by stout iron bars, the gates are built
thick, for increased security.  Outside the gates lie the expanse of the
northern grasslands, across which runs the Earendam road, which leads all
the way to the Brintors.  Inside, Tyril Square marks the beginning of
Earendam proper.

s
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
North of Tyril Square
  The north part of Tyril square lies very near the gates of Earendam,
which lie to the north.  Past the gates are grasslands, and eventually the
Brintor mountains, which provide most of the source of Earendam's mineral
wealth and its building materials.  The gate is mainly used by Brintorean
miners, traders, or the occasionally diplomatic party from Kor Thrandir. 
East and west, the corners of the square end in arched buildings, while a
central fountain dominates the square to the south.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<197hp 132m 25mv> 
e
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Northeast of Tyril Square
  The northeast corner of Tyril Square is formed by the intersection of
Earendam's massive north wall and a squat brownstone building to the east. 
Covered with a cobblestone of glazed brown bricks, the square stretches off
south and west, heading toward the north gates of town to the west, and a
central fountain to the southwest.  The occasional armed patrol lingers
around an arched portcullis to the east, usually coming from or going to the
north gates of the town.  

[Exits: east south west]
A city watchman patrols the streets of Earendam.
A traveling weapon merchant stretches his arms over his head, yawning.

<197hp 132m 24mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
East of Tyril Square
  The east of Tyril Square is covered with a smooth cobblestone of glazed
brown bricks.  Near the north gate of Earendam, Tyril Square is filled with
the traffic of artisans and scholars who inhabit this part of the city.  The
center of the square is west, where a marble statue rises out of the silver
base of a large fountain.  South and north are the edges of the square,
where scholars have set up shop to ply the wares of some of Avendar's most
famous magicks.  To the east Frinian Way heads into the heart of the
artisan's quarter, where scholars and craftsman come to learn and ply their
trade.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<197hp 132m 41mv>

East Frinian Way
  East Frinian Way begins here, serving as a throughway for the scholars
and craftsman who travel to and from Tyril Square to the west and the
artisan's district of Earendam further east.  To the south of the street,
marble stairs lead up to enter some sort of scholar's shop, while the
building to the north is less ostentatious, being a simple stone block
guarded by gate archways.  Home to the Company of the Ram, the building
houses one of Earendam's chartered mercenary companies.  

[Exits: north east south west]

Entrance to the Company of the Ram
  The entrance hall to the Company of the Ram is a well-tended place, with
a martial aura about it.  The brick walls and floors of the place are free
of the typical dust and rubbish of a fighting company, with even the
masonry's cracks and nicks kept mended.  Arched portcullises lead east and
west, and the street lies through a southern entranceway.  North of the
entrance is the main body of this compound.

<197hp 132m 37mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
East Frinian Way
  East Frinian Way heads in a straight east-west line through Earendam's
artisan's district.  Lining the street are shops bearing the products of the
craftsmen who work in this part of the city.  To the south is a jeweller's
shop, which is successful enough to have a plate glass window to display its
wares.  The weapon maker's shop to the north has no such trappings, but
nevertheless bears the symbols of its wares on a stout wooden sign.  Frinian
continues much the same to both the east and west.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<197hp 132m 36mv> 
n
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Vandar's Blades
  Vandar's Blades is a well-furnished shop, offering the wares created by
the craftsman who inhabit the artisan's district of Earendam.  With no forge
in evidence, the shop is remarkably comfortable, offering a wide variety of
weapons on display on the walls behind the counter that takes up the north
half of the room.  The wall to the east is rather thin, and is broken by a
pine door.  A doorway also leads southward onto Frinian Way, which runs in
past the front of the shop.  

[Exits: east south]
Vandar is here, displaying his wares.

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Elrith's Armory
  Elrith's Armory specializes in the fine plate armors produced by the
artisans and earth scholars of Earendam, providing wares for the cities
wealthier nobility.  With most of the merchandise furnished by the artisans
in the surrounding parts of the city, the shop lacks the forge common in
most such places.  The north part of the room is taken up with a counter,
beside which a full set of field plate is arranged on a pole.  A pine door
leads through a wall to the west, and the way onto the street lies south.  

[Exits: south west]
Elrith carefully polishes a piece of armor.

recall
North Wall of the Temple of Darkness
  Earendam's temple of darkness is an architectural hybrid, blending the
classical Republican forms with the statuery of Yithoul and the intricate
carvings of the Srryn.  The temple is topped by a barrel-vaulted roof, which
leads from the southern entrance towards the altar which sits here against
the north wall.  Supporting the ceiling are a series of onyx columns, whose
intricate carvings serve to frame a set of statues in marble, forming a sort
of gallery along the east and west walls.  The altar here is made from
carved ebony, cunningly crafted with the symbols of the order which tends
this temple.  Set on the altar are smoldering censers, which fill the
surrounding air with the smell of myrrh.  

[Exits: east south down]
(White Aura) A priest of the Aklaju offers the services of the dark gods.

The Temple of Darkness
  Earendam's temple of darkness is an architectural hybrid, blending the
classical Republican forms with the statuery of Yithoul and the intricate
carvings of the Srryn.  The temple is topped by a barrel-vaulted roof, which
leads from the southern entrance towards the central altar set in the far
north wall.  Supporting the ceiling are a series of onyx columns, whose
intricate carvings serve to frame a set of statues in marble, forming a sort
of gallery along the east and west walls.  A pair of flaming braziers are
near the southern doorway, which burn red from the light of the smoking
coals.  The air is filled with the cloying smell of myrrh, which drifts
through the air from no apparent source.  

[Exits: north east south]

Before the Gates of the School of Heroes
  Before you stand the gates of the School of Heroes, the renowned center
of training for young adventurers.  It is an enormous structure, composed of
marble, stone, and brick, and has been built upon a rocky hill.  The gates
are forged of wrought iron, and remain open to travelers of every size,
affiliation, and creed.  The central foyer of the School lies ahead, the
marble edifice looming over its well-worn gates.  A small courtyard opens
here, with a beautiful central fountain and a circle of low bushes.  

[Exits: north south]
     A beautiful golden fountain gushes water.

<211hp 140m 4mv> 
The Portal Chamber
  This cubical room is made from blocks of hewn marble.  Benches of similar
stone are set diagonally against the corners of the room, and an open
skylight provides illumination from above.  However, this room is unique in
that it contains four magical gateways which connect the School of Heroes to
various locations in Avendar.  Each glowing with soft blue light, the three
vertical portals are set into the eastern, western, and southern walls.  The
fourth portal is horizontal and circular, and is set into the floor directly
beneath the skylight.  A more mundane doorway leads north, to the courtyard
before the entrance to the School proper.  

[Exits: north east south west down]
(Translucent) A magic mouth hovers in mid-air, grinning nonchalantly.
The magic mouth tells you, 'Are you ready to travel the portals?'
The magic mouth tells you, 'Just say the name of the direction you want to go to learn more.'

Office of Applied Theology
  The office exudes an air of cold formality, dominated by sleek white
marble walls and polished floors that reflect the bright light of hanging
magelights.  The western wall features an expansive mural depicting the
liberation of Var Bandor, set before a wide, heavy desk.  The environment
feels almost sterile, both imposing and inescapable despite the large double
doors perpetually open to Dantaron street.

<211hp 140m 2mv> 
Dantaron Street
  Dantaron Street bisects the west half of Var Bandor, leading from Center
Square to the docks outside the western gatehouse.  Sailors and dockmen
abound in this section of the city, wandering the streets while off-duty. 
The street is composed of well-worn cobblestones, with a few broken and
missing.  To the north, a large temple constructed of fine white marble
rises over the street.  To the south is a traveller's inn.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<211hp 140m 1mv> 
s
The Journey's End
  The Journey's End is a nice inn, though with closer examination you note
cobwebs that would not be present if this inn were in a more reputable part
of town.  A small bar stands in one corner, but most of the hard core
drinkers will go to one of the other numerous pubs along the road.  The
innkeeper stands behind the bar, accepting coin for his rooms upstairs, and
for food and drink alike.  The inn continues to the south, with more tables
for customers to sit down and relax, and there is a small door behind the
bar leading to the innkeeper's personal room.  North is the door back to the
bustle of Dantaron Road.  

[Exits: north (east) south]

In the Tables
  The tables are scattered around the room in what seems to be a random
fashion, but there is still ample space for the barmaids to walk through to
set out food and drinks.  A large fireplace dominates the south wall, the
hearth is swept and ready for a warm fire during the winter.  A small
staircase leads upwards in the south-west corner of the room, to the
comfortable beds waiting for a weary customer to rest upon.  East are the
swinging doors leading to the kitchen, and north lies the entrance to the
inn.

n
The Journey's End
  The Journey's End is a nice inn, though with closer examination you note
cobwebs that would not be present if this inn were in a more reputable part
of town.  A small bar stands in one corner, but most of the hard core
drinkers will go to one of the other numerous pubs along the road.  The
innkeeper stands behind the bar, accepting coin for his rooms upstairs, and
for food and drink alike.  The inn continues to the south, with more tables
for customers to sit down and relax, and there is a small door behind the
bar leading to the innkeeper's personal room.  North is the door back to the
bustle of Dantaron Road.  

[Exits: north (east) south]
The innkeeper bustles around the room, a warm welcoming smile on his round face.
A woman sits here, enjoying the peace of the inn.
A patron of the inn sits here, enjoying a fine meal.
A young boy sits here, spinning a brightly coloured top.

<219hp 140m 14mv> 
n
Dantaron Street
  Dantaron Street bisects the west half of Var Bandor, leading from Center
Square to the docks outside the western gatehouse.  Sailors and dockmen
abound in this section of the city, wandering the streets while off-duty. 
The street is composed of well-worn cobblestones, with a few broken and
missing.  To the north, a large temple constructed of fine white marble
rises over the street.  To the south is a traveller's inn.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<219hp 140m 12mv> 
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A bedraggled orange tabby cat with a tattered ear and a mournful expression is here.
     A large marble fountain gurgles peacefully here.
A nefortu peddler stands in a corner of the square, his goods on a tray before him.
A grey pigeon walks about tentatively, looking for scraps of food.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.

Office of Applied Theology
  The office exudes an air of cold formality, dominated by sleek white
marble walls and polished floors that reflect the bright light of hanging
magelights.  The western wall features an expansive mural depicting the
liberation of Var Bandor, set before a wide, heavy desk.  The environment
feels almost sterile, both imposing and inescapable despite the large double
doors perpetually open to Dantaron street.  

[Exits: north east south down]

<219hp 140m 28mv> 
d
Before the Gates of the School of Heroes
  Before you stand the gates of the School of Heroes, the renowned center
of training for young adventurers.  It is an enormous structure, composed of
marble, stone, and brick, and has been built upon a rocky hill.  The gates
are forged of wrought iron, and remain open to travelers of every size,
affiliation, and creed.  The central foyer of the School lies ahead, the
marble edifice looming over its well-worn gates.  A small courtyard opens
here, with a beautiful central fountain and a circle of low bushes.

<219hp 140m 27mv> 
s
The Portal Chamber
  This cubical room is made from blocks of hewn marble.  Benches of similar
stone are set diagonally against the corners of the room, and an open
skylight provides illumination from above.  However, this room is unique in
that it contains four magical gateways which connect the School of Heroes to
various locations in Avendar.  Each glowing with soft blue light, the three
vertical portals are set into the eastern, western, and southern walls.  The
fourth portal is horizontal and circular, and is set into the floor directly
beneath the skylight.  A more mundane doorway leads north, to the courtyard
before the entrance to the School proper.  

[Exits: north east south west down]
(Translucent) A magic mouth hovers in mid-air, grinning nonchalantly.
The magic mouth tells you, 'Are you ready to travel the portals?'
The magic mouth tells you, 'Just say the name of the direction you want to go to learn more.'

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Entrance to the Tower of Testing
  Just north of the Adventurer's Lounge lies a connecting junction between
it and the Tower of Testing.  This dimly lit vestibule is made of rougher
hewn stone than the smooth bricks of the School proper, giving it a more
ominous air.  A hanging oil lantern which dangles from the ceiling only
enhances this mood, its unsteady light filling the room with trembling
shadows.  Engraved into the stone floor is the iconic sigil of the School of
Heroes, which serves as this chamber's only real ornamentation.  To the
north, the Tower awaits, the many sounds of its beasts echoing off of the
ancient stone walls.

A standing sign offers information to students.

[Exits: north south]

The Beginning of the First Floor
  The Tower of Testing's first floor is a simple and rugged affair, built
of heavy, rough-hewn bricks.  Torches line the grey walls, and a chill
moisture clings to the air.  The floor underfoot is well-trod and packed
with rough mortar.  The first level of the Tower opens up into a low-lit,
open, and shadowy chamber.  There are no windows, and the dank air suggests
that this part is still below ground level.  The chamber continues to the
north, where the screeches of rats and the crackles of torches fill the
quiet air.  

A sign is affixed to an iron stand.

A Breezy Stairwell
  This stairwell is in the far northeast, just outside of the first floor
proper.  It is rugged and dark, lit with flickering torches.  However, as
the stairs climb higher, the chill cling of the air lessens and the basement
scent dims.  Warmer, fresher air travels downward on a faint breeze, causing
the flames to dance wildly atop their torches.  The steps are worn and
smooth, suggesting the passage of many feet.  To the south lies the
rat-infested first floor of the Tower of Testing, while the second floor
awaits above.

The Beginning of the Second Floor
  The second floor of the Tower of Testing is at ground level, with high
windows bringing in light from the outside.  The floor is generally shaped
like a cross, with two long intersecting hallways.  The floor here is the

A Glass Stairwell
  The second floor comes to an end with a stairwell leading upward.  The
tower here begins a transition away from the rough-hewn stone of the lower
levels toward white brick and tile, much like that of the School of Heroes. 
The ceilings are substantially higher than the floor below, with high glass
panels that follow the stairs as they proceed further up.  From here you
have a pleasant but commanding view of Avendar's distant horizons, with
vents letting in further fresh air from above.  The stairway is
significantly warmer than below.

The Beginning of the Third Floor
  The third floor of the Tower of Testing is a stone and tile affair, much
like the School of Heroes.  The bricks are white and lit by lanterns which
hang from the ceiling, as well as the large glass windows which look out
into the surrounding skyscape.  The tiles are dark and well-trod, showing
the scuffs of many young adventurers.  The air on this floor is surprisingly
clear and fresh due to better ventilation; however, it still stings the nose
with the acrid scent of summoning.  Scratches and the spattering of dark
blood mar the floor, ceiling and walls, with the high screech of imps never
far from the ear.  To the south, a glass-enclosed stairwell descends to the
second floor, while the current one continues to the north.

The Beginning of the Third Floor
  The third floor of the Tower of Testing is a stone and tile affair, much
like the School of Heroes.  The bricks are white and lit by lanterns which
hang from the ceiling, as well as the large glass windows which look out
into the surrounding skyscape.  The tiles are dark and well-trod, showing
the scuffs of many young adventurers.  The air on this floor is surprisingly
clear and fresh due to better ventilation; however, it still stings the nose
with the acrid scent of summoning.  Scratches and the spattering of dark
blood mar the floor, ceiling and walls, with the high screech of imps never
far from the ear.  To the south, a glass-enclosed stairwell descends to the
second floor, while the current one continues to the north.  

[Exits: north south]

<182hp 148m 89mv> 
help dual wield
/---------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|          Dual Wield (Skill)                                               |
\---------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Activation lag  :  0.0 rounds
Activation cost :  0 mana

Dual wielding is the ability to use an additional weapon in the character's
offhand. Weapons being dual wielded will suffer a slight penalty in the amount
of damage and have a lesser chance of iterative attacks. Weapon weight must be
considered with this skill, as only weapons lighter then the one being wielded
in the main hand are capable of being dual wielded. Swordmasters are exempt
from this restriction, and can dual wield nearly any two swords they can hold.
Certain unwieldy combinations of weapons will be more awkward to defend
oneself with.

Large-sized races, such as the chaja or alatharya, are able to hold certain
kinds of two-handed weapons with one hand, and dual wield them. The balance of
spears, staves, and polearms are such that this is not possible for these
weapons.

The ambidextrous trait, available upon creation and given to gladiators and
swordmasters automatically, reduces but does not remove the weight
restrictions (though swordmasters have none in either case).


See also: PARRY, AMBIDEXTROUS
An emerald green imp has some big nasty wounds and scratches.

The East Side of the Third Floor
  The third floor of the Tower of Testing is a stone and tile affair, much
like the School of Heroes.  The bricks are white and lit by lanterns which
hang from the ceiling, as well as the large glass windows which look out
into the surrounding skyscape.  The tiles are dark and well-trod, showing
the scuffs of many young adventurers.  The air on this floor is surprisingly
clear and fresh due to better ventilation; however, it still stings the nose
with the acrid scent of summoning.  Scratches and the spattering of dark
blood mar the floor, ceiling and walls save the uncharacteristic cleanliness

The East Side of the Third Floor
  The third floor of the Tower of Testing is a stone and tile affair, much
like the School of Heroes.  The bricks are white and lit by lanterns which
hang from the ceiling, as well as the large glass windows which look out
into the surrounding skyscape.  The tiles are dark and well-trod, showing
the scuffs of many young adventurers.  The air on this floor is surprisingly
clear and fresh due to better ventilation; however, it still stings the nose
with the acrid scent of summoning.  Scratches and the spattering of dark
blood mar the floor, ceiling and walls save the uncharacteristic cleanliness
of the western one.  The hall continues north and south.

help shield block
/---------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|          Shield Block (Skill)                                             |
\---------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Activation lag  :  0.0 rounds
Activation cost :  0 mana

Syntax: Automatic

Shield block is the art of using a shield to ward off blows in melee. This
skill is primarily effective against daggers, and least effective against
whips, flails, maces, and axes. Shield block is the favoured defense
of of water and Void templars and most fighters, though other schools teach
the skill as well.

It's much harder to shield block after an arm has been boneshattered.

An emerald green imp has quite a few wounds.

A Marble Stairwell
  A marble stairwell leads upward to the fourth floor of the Tower of
Testing.  The white stones of the third level end at the entrance to this
stairwell, instead replaced by the iconic marble of the School's main level.
The tile floor looks less worn and of a higher sheen, and the stairwell
itself is polished to a high gloss.  Arched windows look out onto the world
at large, high enough to give the faint of heart a bit of pause.  The sounds
of battle ring out from the floor above.  The long hall of the third floor
lies to the north.

A Marble Stairwell
  A marble stairwell ends at the doorstep of the fourth floor of the Tower
of Testing.  This entire floor is done in the polished black tile of the
School of Heroes proper, and the walls are a high, glossy marble.  The
chamber which composes the fourth floor is the largest and most open yet,
the great expanse of its floor composing a patterned relief of the School's
iconic sigil.  The air is cool but smelling of exertion, blood, and metal. 
Lanterns hang from the ceiling to illuminate the final steps before entering
the floor.  Down the stairs, the third floor awaits.  

A plaque is inset into the wall at the top of the stairs.

Activation lag  :  1.5 rounds
Activation cost :  0 mana


Syntax: Gouge <target>

A trick learned by the arena-fighting gladiators but also used by druids who
have taken on the aspect of the hawk, this skill is an attempt to tear at
another person's eyes. This will deal a small amount of damage and blind them,
if successful.

North Wall of the Temple of Darkness
  Earendam's temple of darkness is an architectural hybrid, blending the
classical Republican forms with the statuery of Yithoul and the intricate
carvings of the Srryn.  The temple is topped by a barrel-vaulted roof, which
leads from the southern entrance towards the altar which sits here against
the north wall.  Supporting the ceiling are a series of onyx columns, whose
intricate carvings serve to frame a set of statues in marble, forming a sort
of gallery along the east and west walls.  The altar here is made from
carved ebony, cunningly crafted with the symbols of the order which tends
this temple.  Set on the altar are smoldering censers, which fill the
surrounding air with the smell of myrrh.

The Temple of Darkness
  Earendam's temple of darkness is an architectural hybrid, blending the
classical Republican forms with the statuery of Yithoul and the intricate
carvings of the Srryn.  The temple is topped by a barrel-vaulted roof, which
leads from the southern entrance towards the central altar set in the far

intricate carvings serve to frame a set of statues in marble, forming a sort

near the southern doorway, which burn red from the light of the smoking
coals.  The air is filled with the cloying smell of myrrh, which drifts

<22hp 156m 108mv> The Temple of Darkness
  Earendam's temple of darkness is an architectural hybrid, blending the
classical Republican forms with the statuery of Yithoul and the intricate
carvings of the Srryn.  The temple is topped by a barrel-vaulted roof, which
leads from the southern entrance towards the central altar set in the far
north wall.  Supporting the ceiling are a series of onyx columns, whose
intricate carvings serve to frame a set of statues in marble, forming a sort
of gallery along the east and west walls.  A pair of flaming braziers are
near the southern doorway, which burn red from the light of the smoking
coals.  The air is filled with the cloying smell of myrrh, which drifts
through the air from no apparent source.  

[Exits: north east south]

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Kaagn Row
  Kaagn row heads east and west along the north banks of the Dantaron, a
road paved with well-worn cobblestones hewn from the Brintors.  Pylons block
off the way to the south, except where a high arched wooden bridge splits
off from the road to cross the Dantaron.  The entirety of the north side of
the street is taken up with a temple of blocks carved from obsidian.  Tall
black steps lead up to the entrance, which is framed by columns, which have
all been carved into complicated piece of statuery.  The tall columns give
the building a gigantic feel, and it seems to tower over the entire street. 

[Exits: north east south west]

Scero Way
  Scero Way heads north and south here, meandering through the outskirts of
Earendam's mercantile quarter.  The wooden tenements of the north have
ceased here, leaving the street surrounding by stone edifices on either
side.  Westward, travel is blocked by the soot-stained wall of a long, low
building.  More dramatically, a tall building carved from obsidian blocks
rises to the east, lofty columns looming over every other surrounding
building.  The street continues northward into an area of tenements and flop
houses, but makes a turn to the south.

Scero Way
  Scero Way heads north and south here, meandering through the outskirts of
Earendam's mercantile quarter.  The buildings seem mainly to be run-down
tenements in varying states of disrepair, except for two notable exceptions.
To the west, a soot-stained brick structure advertises mercenaries for hire.

obsidian, a lofty study in columns and other such stonework, rising above
the surrounding buildings.

<30hp 156m 114mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Mercenary Guild
  A sooty and dank place, this building houses the Company of the Serpent,
one of Earendam's chartered mercenary companies.  Hand-crafted from clay
bricks, the building is built flush with Earendam's west wall.  This room
seems devoid of furnishings, save an ancient desk.  The only illumination in
the room comes from a pitch lantern, which fills the room with a black smoke
while providing only fitful illumination.  The street lies east through an
open doorway, and a small alcove lies to the south.  

[Exits: east south]
A representative of the Company sees to the hiring of mercenaries.

The Dantaron River
  The placid waters of the Dantaron make their way through the city of
Earendam.  Passing between the city's mercantile district to the north, and
the old city to the south, the river is one of the principal avenues for
trade into and out of the city.  The waters of the Dantaron are deep here,
clouded by the dark mud of its bottom, and the frequent river-traffic along
its course.  To the east, the Dantaron flows under a high arched bridge. 
Westward, it flows towards its egress from the city's walls.  

[Exits: north east south west]

By the Earendam Docks
  The Dantaron River flows from the plains to the east, making its way
under the city wall of Earendam to the west, and eventually to the Uthlin
Ocean.  To the north and south the river is lined with the Earendam docks
area, bustling with merchants unloading cargo and passengers disembarking
from barges.  Narrow wooden walkways run from one dock to the next, passing
just overhead.

The Earendam Docks
  A wide wooden docks has been erected just to the north of the River
Dantaron, flowing sluggishly to the south under the city wall.  The docks
are clear of clutter, incoming cargo being regulated closely and required to
move immediately.  An occasional raft or barge can be seen on the river,
arriving or leaving the city.  To the east, the granite walls of Earendam
tower above the dock area.  Several ladders and wooden walkways lead
downward to the water of the river itself.

The West Gate of Earendam
  Earendam's west gates are made of sturdy iron, built between two tall
stone pillars.  Reinforcing these gates are several stout bars of iron,
treated to preserve them from wear.  Outside the gates, the Arien Road heads
west, cutting across the plains which give it its namesake.  Inside, the
Arien Plaza opens, marking the beginning of Earendam proper.

The Western Arien Plaza
  The Arien Plaza comes to an end here as it approaches the western gate of
Earendam.  Travelers and merchants head out through this gate onto the
Arien road, bringing goods to and from the lands to the west.  Set in the
northwestern portion of the city, this plaza is a square ringed on all
sides by the buildings and walls of New Earendam.  Paved with cobblestones
long worn smooth by the feet of travelers entering the city from the Arien
road, the center of the square lies eastward, where an ornate fountain
serves as a resting place for the main body of the populace in the immediate
area.  Shops line the northern edge of the square, while southward the plaza
eventually terminates in a stone wall.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A hulking alatharya porter carries goods for a merchant.
A merchant from Var Bandor strolls through the plaza.

<30hp 156m 101mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Center of Arien Plaza
  The Arien plaza stretches in all directions around this point.  From
here, you can make out the locations on the periphery of this almost
perfectly square plaza.  Travelers head to and from a gate to the west,
filling the square with merchants and others, passing through the city by
way of the Arien road.  Further east, the square eventually leads to the
eastern portion of the city, while a similar passage cuts through a wall a
ways to the south.  The north wall of the plaza is dominated by a series of
shops and taverns, mainly devoted to providing for the merchants who pass
through here.  The exact center of the plaza houses a sizeable granite
fountain, its circular base surrounding a pool whose water source is a
statue of tall caladaran.  The cobblestone ground of the plaza bears shows
many signs of wear and use, the fountain being a popular gathering place for
merchants newly arrived in the city.  A small, square grate sits at the
eastern side of the base of the fountain.  

[Exits: north east south west (down)]
A muscular protector is loitering here, surveying the area casually.

The Eastern Arien Plaza
  The Arien plaza comes to an end here, narrowing to Frinian Way, which
winds eastward into the part of the city known as New Earendam.  The
merchants who mill about the other parts of the plaza thin here, and the
travelers heading east here tend to be artisans or scholars of one form or
the other.  Shops line the sides of the plaza further north and south, and a
fountain dominates the center of the plaza to the west.

The Northeastern Arien Plaza
  The northeastern corner of the Arien Plaza bustles with activity as
merchants and travelers pass through the area, heading to and from the west
gate of the city, which lies southwest.  The open expanse of the plaza
gradually comes to an end here, eventually terminating in a series of shops
to the north, and the wall of a tall building to the east.  Most prominent

the Arien.

Kantilus's General Store
  An older building of stone, Kantilus's shop provides for the needs of

<47hp 156m 70mv> 
North Wall of the Temple of Darkness
  Earendam's temple of darkness is an architectural hybrid, blending the
classical Republican forms with the statuery of Yithoul and the intricate
carvings of the Srryn.  The temple is topped by a barrel-vaulted roof, which
leads from the southern entrance towards the altar which sits here against
the north wall.  Supporting the ceiling are a series of onyx columns, whose
intricate carvings serve to frame a set of statues in marble, forming a sort
of gallery along the east and west walls.  The altar here is made from
carved ebony, cunningly crafted with the symbols of the order which tends
this temple.  Set on the altar are smoldering censers, which fill the
surrounding air with the smell of myrrh.  

[Exits: east south down]
(White Aura) A priest of the Aklaju offers the services of the dark gods.

Before the Gates of the School of Heroes
  Before you stand the gates of the School of Heroes, the renowned center
of training for young adventurers.  It is an enormous structure, composed of
marble, stone, and brick, and has been built upon a rocky hill.  The gates
are forged of wrought iron, and remain open to travelers of every size,
affiliation, and creed.  The central foyer of the School lies ahead, the
marble edifice looming over its well-worn gates.  A small courtyard opens
here, with a beautiful central fountain and a circle of low bushes.

<47hp 156m 34mv> 
The Portal Chamber
  This cubical room is made from blocks of hewn marble.  Benches of similar
stone are set diagonally against the corners of the room, and an open
skylight provides illumination from above.  However, this room is unique in
that it contains four magical gateways which connect the School of Heroes to
various locations in Avendar.  Each glowing with soft blue light, the three
vertical portals are set into the eastern, western, and southern walls.  The
fourth portal is horizontal and circular, and is set into the floor directly
beneath the skylight.  A more mundane doorway leads north, to the courtyard
before the entrance to the School proper.  

[Exits: north east south west down]

The magic mouth tells you, 'Are you ready to travel the portals?'
The magic mouth tells you, 'Just say the name of the direction you want to go to learn more.'

North Hall
  The log-walled hallway known as North Hall runs the length of the
northernmost section of Krilin Fortress.  The wood of the walls is sanded
and polished to perfection, the work of many hours.  The logs of the floor
are fitted together perfectly, and have been worn smooth by the passing of
thousands of feet.  Oil lamps hanging on the wall give the interior of the
fortress a warm light.  Saer Hall is to the south, lined with the doors of
living chambers.

The Foundry
  A large room with wooden walls blackened from smoke, the foundry is
dominated by a clay furnace set against the west wall.  It is here that the
ores produced by the mining community of Krilin are purified into workable
metals.  Iron troughs used to hold the molten ores lay about the foundry,
marked with enchanted runes to prevent melting.  Cinders float up from the
mouth of the furnace, and a withering heat floods the room.  A large brick
chimney ascends through the ceiling, carrying the smoke and heat upward.  

[Exits: east south]
A burly man works at the foundry, transforming ores into workable metals.

  The sturdy, iron-bound gates of Krilin Fortress open into an entry hall. 
The walls and floor are constructed of thick wooden slats, polished to a
bright smoothness by thousands of passersby.  The entry hall is lit by oil
lanterns hanging on the walls.  To the north, the hall continues into the
fortress itself.  To the west, a guarded stairwell leads into the upper
portion of the fortress, and to the east, a small guard station has been
erected.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<76hp 164m 44mv> 
n
Front Hall
  The wide hallway known as Front Hall runs the length of Krilin Fortress,
from Residence Hall to the west to Saer Hall to the east, along the southern
portion of the fortress.  The broadly built passage is lit by cheerfully
flickering oil lamps, and swept regularly to produce an efficient
cleanliness.  To the north, Central Hall bisects the fortress, and south is
the entry hall.  A small sign has been placed upon the wall.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A well in the center of the common area supplies the fortress with water.
A Krilin sentry stands guard.
A merchant from Earendam stands in the Fortress, transacting business.

North Hall
  The log-walled hallway known as North Hall runs the length of the
northernmost section of Krilin Fortress.  The wood of the walls is sanded
and polished to perfection, the work of many hours.  The logs of the floor
are fitted together perfectly, and have been worn smooth by the passing of
thousands of feet.  Oil lamps hanging on the wall give the interior of the
fortress a warm light.  Saer Hall is to the south, lined with the doors of
living chambers.

The Northeast Stairs
  The wooden stairs under your feet give solid purchase for your boots,
with no creaking or other signs of weakness.  They seem well cared-for, and
the wood is brightly polished.  As you walk them, you notice very little by
way of ornamentation on the stairs, no rugs, enamel, or stonework.  At the

ascend to the battlements of Krilin Fortress.

The Battlements of Krilin Fortress
  The battlements of Krilin Fortress are constructed of the sturdiest of
wood, a double layer of logs protecting the soldiers as they pace their
rounds.  Notches for archers have been built into the battlements, complete
with small stairs for soldiers to stand on while shooting, and thick wooden
panels that slide in to protect the notches when not in use.  Over the
battlements, the peaks of the Brintor Mountains are visible in the distance
to the east.  

[Exits: south west down]
A Krilin soldier paces the battlements, watching the mountains for trouble.

<95hp 164m 20mv> 
recall
North Wall of the Temple of Darkness
  Earendam's temple of darkness is an architectural hybrid, blending the
classical Republican forms with the statuery of Yithoul and the intricate
carvings of the Srryn.  The temple is topped by a barrel-vaulted roof, which
leads from the southern entrance towards the altar which sits here against
the north wall.  Supporting the ceiling are a series of onyx columns, whose
intricate carvings serve to frame a set of statues in marble, forming a sort
of gallery along the east and west walls.  The altar here is made from
carved ebony, cunningly crafted with the symbols of the order which tends
this temple.  Set on the altar are smoldering censers, which fill the
surrounding air with the smell of myrrh.  

[Exits: east south down]
(White Aura) A priest of the Aklaju offers the services of the dark gods.

Before the Gates of the School of Heroes
  Before you stand the gates of the School of Heroes, the renowned center
of training for young adventurers.  It is an enormous structure, composed of
marble, stone, and brick, and has been built upon a rocky hill.  The gates
are forged of wrought iron, and remain open to travelers of every size,
affiliation, and creed.  The central foyer of the School lies ahead, the
marble edifice looming over its well-worn gates.  A small courtyard opens
here, with a beautiful central fountain and a circle of low bushes.

<95hp 164m 9mv> 
The Portal Chamber
  This cubical room is made from blocks of hewn marble.  Benches of similar
stone are set diagonally against the corners of the room, and an open
skylight provides illumination from above.  However, this room is unique in
that it contains four magical gateways which connect the School of Heroes to
various locations in Avendar.  Each glowing with soft blue light, the three
vertical portals are set into the eastern, western, and southern walls.  The
fourth portal is horizontal and circular, and is set into the floor directly
beneath the skylight.  A more mundane doorway leads north, to the courtyard
before the entrance to the School proper.  

[Exits: north east south west down]
(Translucent) A magic mouth hovers in mid-air, grinning nonchalantly.
The magic mouth tells you, 'Are you ready to travel the portals?'
The magic mouth tells you, 'Just say the name of the direction you want to go to learn more.'

The Journey's End
  The Journey's End is a nice inn, though with closer examination you note
cobwebs that would not be present if this inn were in a more reputable part
of town.  A small bar stands in one corner, but most of the hard core
drinkers will go to one of the other numerous pubs along the road.  The

bustle of Dantaron Road.

<105hp 164m 23mv> 
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.  

[Exits: north east south west]

Raddin Street

<112hp 151m 27mv> 
help corner
/---------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|          Corner (Skill)                                                   |
\---------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Activation lag  :  2.5 rounds
Activation cost :  30 mana

Syntax: Automatic

With their training often placing them in a tight spot or vastly outnumbered
for showmanship and crowd-pleasing affects, gladiators are able to fight in
such a way that they are able to take a full round of attacks against each
opponent who is fighting them. Contrary to popular belief, the visual
spectacle of this skill is solely reliant on the sheer number of attacks;
this skill provides no bonus damage to the gladiator at any time.
