<352hp 203m 221mv> 
The Saurian Armory
  This armory is unusually hot, presumably both because of the kiln against
the shop's north wall, and because of the tastes of its clientele.  An anvil
sits prominently near it, with a variety of tools stewn haphazardly about
the room.  Examples of the shop's unique wares hang from the walls, the
mounted skull-masks and intricately carved metal plates leering from the
aging walls.  Various hide and bone fetishes serve as the room's only other
apparent decorations, giving the entire affair a far more barbarous feel. 
The floor is marked by small scorches, where still-hot metal made a lasting
impression upon it.  To the south is Raddin Street, and the far cooler air
of the city.  

[Exits: south]
A huge, red-scaled srryn blacksmith tends his shop.

<352hp 203m 218mv> 
Iron Street
  Iron street is in a working class part of Var Bandor, and is far from
being one of the nicer areas in the city.  Men walk about along the street
going about their business, and few seem to notice you here.  Some small,
cramped houses line the streets between the larger warehouses, and some
children wearing ragged clothes can be seen playing outdoors.  The people
here do not seem as happy as those in the nicer parts of the city--a faint
air of oppression hangs over the working class folk of Iron Street.  To the
east is Sadrent Road.

You open your eyes and cast your gaze upon the land.
You received 405 experience today.
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.  

[Exits: north east south west]

made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters

within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for

cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.

Ilrin Street
  A wide street composed of black stones and carefully-arranged curbs,
Ilrin Street runs the length of southern Var Bandor, winding among the
gloriously rich houses of the merchants and the eccentrically constructed
towers of the scholars.  Here and there, baskets of flowers hang from the
sides of buildings, and hired servants tend to shaped shrubs.  The streets
in the southern part of town are swept clean, and all animal traffic is
prohibited.  The Var Bandor Center Square is to the north.

<468hp 468m 277mv> 
The Gleaming Blade
  Torches adorn both side walls and sit upright in their gilded holders. 
Their light flickers and causes the various bladed weapons to glint sharply.
Several studded maces, and various other weapons of destruction are lined
along the walls in weapon racks.  A spinning stone wheel, used for
sharpening blades, stands near the back of the shop with a bucket of water
next to it to help with the enormous amount of heat produced during the
process.  You can exit back to the west.

Commerce Street
  Surrounded by newly constructed buildings, Commerce Street winds through
the merchant quarter of Var Bandor.  All around are signs of great wealth,
the gold that flows from the prosperous trade evident in the buildings, the
clothing of the citizens, and the meticulous maintenance of the streets.  To
the east is a fine weapon store, and to the west is a gem shop.

Commerce Street

the merchant quarter of Var Bandor.  All around are signs of great wealth,
the gold that flows from the prosperous trade evident in the buildings, the

<468hp 468m 271mv> 
e
Ilrin Street
  A wide street composed of black stones and carefully-arranged curbs,
Ilrin Street runs the length of southern Var Bandor, winding among the
gloriously rich houses of the merchants and the eccentrically constructed
towers of the scholars.  Here and there, baskets of flowers hang from the
sides of buildings, and hired servants tend to shaped shrubs.  The streets
in the southern part of town are swept clean, and all animal traffic is
prohibited.  To the west, Commerce Street winds around the merchant quarter.

<468hp 468m 263mv> You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Forge of the Golden Sands
  This cramped, low room is thick with a smoky haze, the dry, warm air
heavy with the acrid smells of the forge.  A large, cluttered workbench
fills one corner entirely, covered with scraps of metal and a jumble of
tools.  In another corner, a round forge made from bricks of shaped clay
glows brightly, the orange-red light pouring through the small, grilled
opening.  A low counter divides the room from north to south, and several
low cushions of rich fabric have been set out for customers to wait upon. 
The low roofbeams of aged wood are charred slightly in a few places, but
otherwise the shop is quite well-kept.  A floor of magically smooth stone is
clean and neat, but for accumulated splashes of spilled metal near the
forge.  A rich tapestry hangs on the east wall, beside a luxurious, gilded
door.  The room is lit by several glowing orbs above the workbench, tempered
with the fiery light of the forge.  

A slate sign rests upon the counter.

[Exits: east]
Psentil the jeweler works hunched over his bench.

Arcanos Street
  Arcanos Street is a wide avenue paved with gray stones.  The buildings in
this section of town show an odd architecture, as if they are designed for
purposes other than the usual.  Visible are pyramidic rooftops, domed
towers, and arched entryways.  Controlled by the scholar faction of Var
Bandor, this area is well cared for, with hired servants sweeping the
cobblestones and running errands to and fro.  To the west, Ilrin Street runs
to the southern gatehouse.

<468hp 468m 256mv> Toromia's Laboratory
  This unusual laboratory was probably a residence once, but its interior
has been entirely reworked for creation.  Shaped figures and body parts,
ranging from simple stone to iron to forged steel, are organized by type and
material.  Assembled, but inanimate, statues stand in rows, waiting to be
granted the unlife for which the shop is so well-known.  A large counter is
lined with tools and magic devices, bearing runic markings of Earth and
Void.  The room's sparse decorations are lost amongst the statues, and the
only exit leads north onto Arcanos Street.  

[Exits: north]
Toromia, a composite of flesh, gear, and magic shuffles about.

<468hp 468m 265mv> 
Inside the Southern Gatehouse
  The southern gatehouse of Var Bandor is an elaborate affair,
well-maintained and proper.  A close watch is kept on the kind of traveler
allowed to enter the finest districts of the city, and a roster of those
banned from the area is kept nearby.  The immense granite walls rise to
either side of the gates, and to the south, the outskirts of Var Bandor run
into a thickly wooded area.  North, Ilrin Street leads into the heart of the
city.  

[Exits: north south]
A soldier of the Var Bandor Guard watches the gatehouse.
A soldier of the Var Bandor Guard watches the gatehouse.

Outside the Southern Gatehouse
  You stand outside the southern wall of Var Bandor.  To the south, the
twin forks of the River Dantaron curve eastward and westard, and between the
silvery lines of water a lush forested area is visible.  In the distance you
hear sounds of commerce, yelling and the noises of people working.

<468hp 468m 262mv> 
Trail into the Forest
  This trail winds its way southward, through the downland south of Var
Bandor, toward the Forest of Nendor.  The edges of the dirt path are lined
with smooth stones.  Stony grassland spreads to either side beyond the chalk
stone border, and the Nendorin woods spread before you to the south.  Back
northward the walls of Var Bandor are still visible, albeit barely.  

[Exits: north south]

<468hp 468m 261mv> 
s
The Forest Path
  A thin but well worn path winds through the forest of Nendor.  Stones
inscribed with odd runic markings dot the side of the path every now and
again, standing on the border between road and forest.  Large oaks line the
path on either side, leaves casting shade upon the path below.  The singing
of birds echoes through the forest, providing a constant murmur of sound.  The

A Rutted Path Through the Waste
  This path winds through the cracked plains of the waste.  Deep ruts mark
this road, dug by years of caravan wagons carrying trade through the desert.
The air about you is dry, the moisture baked away by the fierce rays of the
sun.  Few clouds drift past the western mountains visible far to the west,
and those that do are quickly evaporated in the heat.  Vegetation is sparse,
little growing save the occasion thorny bush or defiant tuft of brown grass.
The savannah is visible over a bridge to the north while the rutted path
winds southward.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<468hp 468m 250mv> 
e
The Dry, Cracked Plains
  Looking over the gully to the north, you can see the yellow-green spread
of the savannah.  No such verdant sprawl lies here, only cracked, sunbaked
clay.  The waste spreads south from the plains, a vast, unending carpet of
sandy brown.  The air is dry here, little moisture making it over the
mountains visible over the western horizon.  Clouds rarely pass through the
sky overhead, and seldom remain when they do.  The puffs of moisture are
rapidly evaporated by the burning sun.  The vegetation here is sparse, with
few plants hardy enough to survive the withering heat of the sun.  Eastward,
foothills rise from the cracked sand, blocking egress.

You open your eyes and cast your gaze upon the land.
You received 225 experience today.
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.

<363hp 210m 232mv> 
note
[  0] Iandir: Welcome to Avendar
Tue Oct 29 22:51:07 2024
To: all immortal
Welcome to Avendar.  Whether this is your first character or the latest
of many, we appreciate you joining us.  If you have not played in some time,
be aware that there have been significant changes to classes, lineages,
skills, spells, items, encounters, and the world in general.  Many things
may be very different from how you remember them being.  

A summary of some of our recent updates:

- Most restrictions on possible lineage and class combinations have been
removed.  

- Stats, HP, and MP may no longer be trained.  HP/MP is now based on class
alone.  Stats will automatically advance as you level.  Please see HELP
STATS for more information.  

- Skill practicing is now decoupled from stats.  Most skills will now always
practice to 75%.  

- All stats have been rebalanced and what each stat does has changed. 
Please see HELP STATS for more information.  

- All bonuses and penalties to experience gain based on resonance/aura have
been removed.  This will still affect your own aura.  

- Girikha is dead, slain by adventurers by command of Iandir.  

- The saint/demigod Calaera no longer acts as an independent deity, and no
longer issues sigils or god touches.  

- The sacrifice and god touch mechanics have both been significantly
revised.  Please see HELP SACRIFICE and HELP GOD TOUCH for more information.

- The Guardians of Law are no longer a Great House.  - The role of Great
Houses and their criteria for joining has changed.  Please see HELP GREAT
HOUSE for more information.  

- Kankoran are in the process of being removed entirely from Avendar and
their existence retconned.  Kankoran NPCs still exist for now as do
references to kankoran, but all are in the process of being rewritten, and
new kankoran PCs may not be made.  Please see HELP KANKORAN for more
information.  

- Most lineages have been given significant expansions to their histories,
cultures, and/or aesthetics.  Please see the relevant help files and the
wiki for more information.  

Updates to our in-game help files to accurately represent added skills,
spells, and other mechanical changes are in progress.  In the mean time,
please check out our website or direct any questions to our Discord.  

Thanks for playing with us, we hope you have fun.

  A wide street composed of black stones and carefully-arranged curbs,
Ilrin Street runs the length of southern Var Bandor, winding among the
gloriously rich houses of the merchants and the eccentrically constructed
towers of the scholars.  Here and there, baskets of flowers hang from the
sides of buildings, and hired servants tend to shaped shrubs.  The streets
in the southern part of town are swept clean, and all animal traffic is
prohibited.  The Var Bandor Center Square is to the north.

The Auction House
  This chamber is profusely decorated with expensive artwork and antique
furniture, much of it discreetly labeled with extortionate prices.  Several
rows of bench seating dominate the room, facing a podium set atop a small
stage.  The room is brilliantly lit, allowing excellent views of the
merchandise for sale here, and seals of Merchant Council licensing are
prominently displayed.  A sign sits atop a table on the side, detailing how
proceedings occur here.  A grand double-doorway opens southwards onto
Commerce Street.

The Armorer
  The sounds of a hammer ringing as it strikes a piece of iron is the first
thing that assaults your ears as you enter the store.  You can also hear the
whishing of the bellows as it blows into the furnace to increase the heat of
the fire.  Shirts made of fine steel, leggings, sleeves, and assorted mails
of all type are all on display hanging from the walls.  Besides the forge
near the back of the store, the rest of the building looks immaculately
clean giving a sense of regality not normally associated with a smithy-type
shop.  You can exit back to the west.

<406hp 244m 186mv> 
The Gleaming Blade
  Torches adorn both side walls and sit upright in their gilded holders. 
Their light flickers and causes the various bladed weapons to glint sharply.
Several studded maces, and various other weapons of destruction are lined
along the walls in weapon racks.  A spinning stone wheel, used for
sharpening blades, stands near the back of the shop with a bucket of water
next to it to help with the enormous amount of heat produced during the
process.  You can exit back to the west.

Ilrin Street
  A wide street composed of black stones and carefully-arranged curbs,
Ilrin Street runs the length of southern Var Bandor, winding among the
gloriously rich houses of the merchants and the eccentrically constructed
towers of the scholars.  Here and there, baskets of flowers hang from the
sides of buildings, and hired servants tend to shaped shrubs.  The streets
in the southern part of town are swept clean, and all animal traffic is
prohibited.  To the east, Arcanos Street winds among the scholars' towers,
and to the west Commerce Street leads to the merchant quarter.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<406hp 244m 173mv> 
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.

Outside the Northern Gatehouse
  The towering gates of Var Bandor rise to the south.  Huge, heavy wooden
doors reinforced with iron bars, the gates are maintained rigorously.  The
walls to the east and west are solid stone, with murder slits.  To the
north, the river Dantaron splits into two mighty forks which flow by Var
Bandor on either side.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<409hp 299m 173mv> 
s
Inside the Northern Gatehouse
  This gatehouse house is built behind the gates of Sadrent, the oldest of
the gates into Var Bandor.  Outside, to the north, a ferry leads across the
Dantaron river, while to the south Sadrent road snakes its way into the
city.  The gatehouse is ill-tended, leading in to the poorest section of the
city, and consequently little attention is paid to the traffic of riff-raff
and n'er-do-wells through these wrought iron gates.  

[Exits: north south]
A soldier of the Var Bandor Guard watches the gatehouse.

Sadrent Road
  Sadrent Road runs the length of northern Var Bandor, winding its way
through the worst parts of town.  Built on the delta when Var Bandor was
founded, the northern buildings are the oldest, and consequently have become
the slum area.  Sadrent Road itself is a wide band of filthy cobblestones
winding between the ruined buildings.  To the east and west is a squalid
alley.

By the Docks
  The wooden docks of Var Bandor are arrayed to the west, bustling with
merchants, travelers, dockhands, and various other people.  The walls of the
city itself rise beyond the dock area, grand stone edifices designed to
protect the inhabitants of Var Bandor.  The river Aragol flows northward to

of the water which swirls sluggishly along.  Large cleats are wound with
thick ropes for mooring, and filthy canvas fenders hang off the edges of the
docks.

<385hp 346m 184mv> Inside the Northern Gatehouse
  This gatehouse house is built behind the gates of Sadrent, the oldest of
the gates into Var Bandor.  Outside, to the north, a ferry leads across the
Dantaron river, while to the south Sadrent road snakes its way into the
city.  The gatehouse is ill-tended, leading in to the poorest section of the
city, and consequently little attention is paid to the traffic of riff-raff
and n'er-do-wells through these wrought iron gates.  

[Exits: north south]

Inside the Northern Gatehouse
  This gatehouse house is built behind the gates of Sadrent, the oldest of
the gates into Var Bandor.  Outside, to the north, a ferry leads across the
Dantaron river, while to the south Sadrent road snakes its way into the
city.  The gatehouse is ill-tended, leading in to the poorest section of the
city, and consequently little attention is paid to the traffic of riff-raff
and n'er-do-wells through these wrought iron gates.

several men, provisions, and various clutter.  Apparently this is the
temporary camp of a mining party.  Further evidence lies in mine shafts sunk
into the east and west walls of the cave, and mine carts partially filled
with ore.  The main cave continues north and south.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A mining cart carries recently mined ore.
A burly miner, hardened by years of work, digs tirelessly at the cave wall.
A miner bends to his work, carving away at the cave wall.

dirt of the cave floor is disturbed by occasional footprints.

<458hp 246m 150mv>

  A gap in the face of the hill opens into a large cave.  The walls are
slick with condensed moisture and growths of fungus.  There is a musty air
to the natural passage that leads north.  Many footprints mar the soft dirt

<458hp 246m 148mv> 
A Path to a Hill
  To the north, the path veers sharply toward a cluster of low foothills. 
An opening in the face of the nearest hill leads into a cavern, and to the
south, the lower foothills spread vastly.  Far in the distance, the peaks of
the Brintor Mountains tower above the horizon, a grand spectacle in the
background.  

[Exits: north south]

<458hp 246m 147mv>

A Path to a Hill
  To the north, the path veers sharply toward a cluster of low foothills. 
An opening in the face of the nearest hill leads into a cavern, and to the
south, the lower foothills spread vastly.  Far in the distance, the peaks of
the Brintor Mountains tower above the horizon, a grand spectacle in the
background.  

[Exits: north south]

<457hp 246m 195mv> 
The Mouth of the Cave
  A gap in the face of the hill opens into a large cave.  The walls are
slick with condensed moisture and growths of fungus.  There is a musty air
to the natural passage that leads north.  Many footprints mar the soft dirt
of the cave floor, packing it into a regular path in some areas.  

[Exits: north south]

A Damp Cave
  The damp cave continues, leading into the darkness to the north, and
toward the light of a cave mouth to the south.  The cave walls drip with
moisture, and subterranean fungi grow in colored patches.  The dirt of the
floor is packed by many footprints.

<457hp 246m 192mv> 
n
The Mining Camp
  This stretch of cave is crowded with mining equipment, bedrolls for
several men, provisions, and various clutter.  Apparently this is the
temporary camp of a mining party.  Further evidence lies in a mine shaft
sunk into the west wall of the cave, and three mine carts partially filled
with ore.  The main cave continues north and south.  

[Exits: north south west]

Inside the Northern Gatehouse
  This gatehouse house is built behind the gates of Sadrent, the oldest of
the gates into Var Bandor.  Outside, to the north, a ferry leads across the
Dantaron river, while to the south Sadrent road snakes its way into the
city.  The gatehouse is ill-tended, leading in to the poorest section of the
city, and consequently little attention is paid to the traffic of riff-raff
and n'er-do-wells through these wrought iron gates.

<458hp 246m 168mv> 
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.

<458hp 246m 167mv> 
Ilrin Street
  A wide street composed of black stones and carefully-arranged curbs,
Ilrin Street runs the length of southern Var Bandor, winding among the
gloriously rich houses of the merchants and the eccentrically constructed
towers of the scholars.  Here and there, baskets of flowers hang from the
sides of buildings, and hired servants tend to shaped shrubs.  The streets
in the southern part of town are swept clean, and all animal traffic is
prohibited.  The Var Bandor Center Square is to the north.

The Armorer
  The sounds of a hammer ringing as it strikes a piece of iron is the first
thing that assaults your ears as you enter the store.  You can also hear the
whishing of the bellows as it blows into the furnace to increase the heat of
the fire.  Shirts made of fine steel, leggings, sleeves, and assorted mails
of all type are all on display hanging from the walls.  Besides the forge
near the back of the store, the rest of the building looks immaculately
clean giving a sense of regality not normally associated with a smithy-type
shop.  You can exit back to the west.

<458hp 246m 163mv> The Armorer
  The sounds of a hammer ringing as it strikes a piece of iron is the first
thing that assaults your ears as you enter the store.  You can also hear the
whishing of the bellows as it blows into the furnace to increase the heat of
the fire.  Shirts made of fine steel, leggings, sleeves, and assorted mails
of all type are all on display hanging from the walls.  Besides the forge
near the back of the store, the rest of the building looks immaculately
clean giving a sense of regality not normally associated with a smithy-type
shop.  You can exit back to the west.

The Gleaming Blade
  Torches adorn both side walls and sit upright in their gilded holders. 
Their light flickers and causes the various bladed weapons to glint sharply.
Several studded maces, and various other weapons of destruction are lined
along the walls in weapon racks.  A spinning stone wheel, used for
sharpening blades, stands near the back of the shop with a bucket of water
next to it to help with the enormous amount of heat produced during the
process.  You can exit back to the west.

e
Ilrin Street
  A wide street composed of black stones and carefully-arranged curbs,
Ilrin Street runs the length of southern Var Bandor, winding among the
gloriously rich houses of the merchants and the eccentrically constructed
towers of the scholars.  Here and there, baskets of flowers hang from the
sides of buildings, and hired servants tend to shaped shrubs.  The streets
in the southern part of town are swept clean, and all animal traffic is
prohibited.  To the east, Arcanos Street winds among the scholars' towers,
and to the west Commerce Street leads to the merchant quarter.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A young scholar of Var Bandor walks along the street.

Arcanos Street
  Arcanos Street is a wide avenue paved with gray stones.  The buildings in
this section of town show an odd architecture, as if they are designed for
purposes other than the usual.  Visible are pyramidic rooftops, domed
towers, and arched entryways.  Controlled by the scholar faction of Var
Bandor, this area is well cared for, with hired servants sweeping the
cobblestones and running errands to and fro.  To the north is an oddly
shaped residence.  West is Ilrin Street.

<458hp 246m 190mv> You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
An Oddly-formed Residence
  The inside of this house is a sight to behold.  The room itself is much
larger than it appears from the outside, disorienting you slightly. 
Flickering flames provide a warm light, although most of the flames just
seem to be floating in mid-air by the walls, not attached to any sort of
source.  Many portraits line the walls, and magical feather dusters fly
about the room, making sure no dust mars the beautiful appearance of the
room, and its many magical toys.  A plush red couch sits against one wall,
and a small table sits in front of it.  On the table, an illusion of a
dancer moves inside a small glass globe.  Inset into the north wall, a
doorway leads into what appears to be a laboratory, and Arcanos lies out the
door to the south.

gloriously rich houses of the merchants and the eccentrically constructed
towers of the scholars.  Here and there, baskets of flowers hang from the

in the southern part of town are swept clean, and all animal traffic is
prohibited.  To the east, Arcanos Street winds among the scholars' towers,

n
Inside the Southern Gatehouse
  The southern gatehouse of Var Bandor is an elaborate affair,
well-maintained and proper.  A close watch is kept on the kind of traveler
allowed to enter the finest districts of the city, and a roster of those
banned from the area is kept nearby.  The immense granite walls rise to
either side of the gates, and to the south, the outskirts of Var Bandor run
into a thickly wooded area.  North, Ilrin Street leads into the heart of the
city.  

[Exits: north south]
A soldier of the Var Bandor Guard watches the gatehouse.
A soldier of the Var Bandor Guard watches the gatehouse.

<458hp 246m 172mv> 
Ilrin Street
  A wide street composed of black stones and carefully-arranged curbs,
Ilrin Street runs the length of southern Var Bandor, winding among the
gloriously rich houses of the merchants and the eccentrically constructed
towers of the scholars.  Here and there, baskets of flowers hang from the
sides of buildings, and hired servants tend to shaped shrubs.  The streets
in the southern part of town are swept clean, and all animal traffic is
prohibited.  To the east, Arcanos Street leads to the scholars' towers.

<458hp 246m 161mv> 
n
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A bedraggled orange tabby cat with a tattered ear and a mournful expression is here.

Sadrent Road
  Sadrent Road runs the length of northern Var Bandor, winding its way
through the worst parts of town.  Built on the delta when Var Bandor was
founded, the northern buildings are the oldest, and consequently have become
the slum area.  Sadrent Road itself is a wide band of filthy cobblestones
winding between the ruined buildings.  To the south is the central square of
Var Bandor.

Raddin Street
  Raddin Street, named after an ancient hero from the War of Fire, wends
its way east and west through Var Bandor.  Once a thriving part of town
known for its reputation as a home for men of action, it now serves as the
stomping ground for Var Bandor's cheaper hired swords.  A carved shield

towers of the scholars.  Here and there, baskets of flowers hang from the
sides of buildings, and hired servants tend to shaped shrubs.  The streets
in the southern part of town are swept clean, and all animal traffic is
prohibited.  To the west is the guild of watchers, while Naidji Alley lies to
the east.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<458hp 246m 165mv> 
Inside the Southern Gatehouse
  The southern gatehouse of Var Bandor is an elaborate affair,
well-maintained and proper.  A close watch is kept on the kind of traveler
allowed to enter the finest districts of the city, and a roster of those
banned from the area is kept nearby.  The immense granite walls rise to
either side of the gates, and to the south, the outskirts of Var Bandor run
into a thickly wooded area.  North, Ilrin Street leads into the heart of the
city.  

[Exits: north south]
A soldier of the Var Bandor Guard watches the gatehouse.
A soldier of the Var Bandor Guard watches the gatehouse.

Trail into the Forest
  This trail winds its way southward, through the downland south of Var
Bandor, toward the Forest of Nendor.  The edges of the dirt path are lined
with smooth stones.  Stony grassland spreads to either side beyond the chalk
stone border, and the Nendorin woods spread before you to the south.  Back
northward the walls of Var Bandor are still visible, albeit barely.

whe
<458hp 246m 161mv> 
The Forest Path
  A thin but well worn path winds through the forest of Nendor.  Stones
inscribed with odd runic markings dot the side of the path every now and
again, standing on the border between road and forest.  Large oaks line the
path on either side, leaves casting shade upon the path below.  The singing
of birds echoes through the forest, providing a constant murmur of sound.  The
path runs south from the north, leading deeper into the forest.  To the
east and west, breaks in the thick treeline are visible.  

[Exits: north east south west]

An Old Carriageway
  The faint trail to the south ends suddenly here, but not before it runs
into the remnants of an old carriageway.  This rutted track heads both east
and west from here, making a straight path through the deepening woods. 
From the thickness of the nettles and grass tussocks which stud the path,
and the occasional badger hole which breaches it, it would appear that the
carriageway hasn't been used in some time.

<458hp 246m 144mv> By the Ivy-Covered Gate Posts
  The old carriageway continues south, passing between a pair of old,
stone gateposts.  The posts are of mortared bluestone blocks, roughly hewn,
and built into pinnacles some six feet high.  The gates themselves have long
since vanished, and all that remains of them are the heavy iron hinges,
bolted to the stone.  Thick ivy covers the gateposts, and the surrounding
shrubs almost completely obscure their presence.  To the south the path
continues through the trees, while on the northern side of the posts it
turns sharply west.

<458hp 246m 163mv> 
l
By the Ivy-Covered Gate Posts
  The old carriageway continues south, passing between a pair of old,
stone gateposts.  The posts are of mortared bluestone blocks, roughly hewn,
and built into pinnacles some six feet high.  The gates themselves have long
since vanished, and all that remains of them are the heavy iron hinges,
bolted to the stone.  Thick ivy covers the gateposts, and the surrounding
shrubs almost completely obscure their presence.  To the south the path
continues through the trees, while on the northern side of the posts it
turns sharply west.  

[Exits: north south]

<458hp 246m 183mv> 
s
s
A Rutted Carriageway
  A rutted carriageway winds north and south here, between the trees of
Nendor forest.  Once cobbled with flat, white stones, the path is now badly
overgrown.  The stones are now pushed askew by grasses and saplings, or lie
buried in the mud which crowds in from the edges.  The leafy boughs of the
tall, slender trees hang over the carriage-way, forming a light tunnel.  To
the north the path passes some old gate posts, while to the south the trees
give way, revealing an ivy-covered manor house.  

[Exits: north south]

s
<458hp 246m 182mv> 
By the Doors of an Old Mansion
  Looming above you to the south is an old, stone mansion.  The building is
two stories high, with a tall bluestone tower set into the northwestern
corner. Most of this front face of the mansion is covered with thick ivy,
blending the building with the surrounding forest.  Only a few patches of
lichen-ridden stone look out from the ivy, and shattered windows high
overhead peer blankly at the tree-tops.  The carriageway, which leads north
into the forest, turns east here, and disappears around the side of the
mansion. A set of heavy oak doors hang loose on their hinges to the south. 

[Exits: north east (south) west]

e
A Rutted Carriageway, Beneath the Northern Face
  The carriageway runs beneath the front, northern face of an old,
ivy-covered mansion here.  This face of the mansion is intact, although
badly weathered, and a few shattered windows peek out from amidst the shroud
of green.  Looking through these windows, it seems that the rooms
immediately behind this wall have collapsed into ruin.  A little way to the
east the carriage-way turns around the side of the building and heads south,
while directly to the west it runs past the mansion's front door.  The thick
growth of the forest blocks the way north.  

[Exits: east west]

A Bend in a Rutted Carriageway
  The overgrown carriageway turns south here, travelling down the side of
the old mansion, and to the west, past the mansion's front.  In the distance
to the south, beyond the rear of the mansion, can be seen the carriage
house.  Nearer-by, the forest presses in from the east and north, with leafy
boughs leaning over the path.  The mansion, ruined in places, looms to the
west.

A Rutted Carriageway 
  The rutted carriageway passes beneath the ruined eastern side of the
mansion here.  The entire two stories of the building lie toppled in ruin
just to the west, and stones lie scattered across the path, moss-covered and
half-buried in mud.  Further south the mansion is still largely intact,
although the walls are beginning to crumble.  The carriage-way passes
beneath these walls before reaching a smaller, wooden structure in the
distance.  To the east the forest presses thickly against the road.

A Rutted Carriageway

of ivy, and badly weathered.  The carriageway becomes quite muddy here,

<458hp 246m 192mv> 
A Rutted Carriageway 
  The carriageway runs past another partially-collapsed section of the
building here.  The lower floor still stands, but the upper has crumbled to
ruin.  Nothing remains of the walls above but a few jutting fingers of
stone, silhouetted against the sky.  Amongst the stones perches a leering
gargoyle, its form horribly reptillian.  A stream of water trickles along
one of the ruts in the ground, flowing from north to south.  To the south
the path soon comes to an end, by the wide doors of an old carriage house. 
To the north the path continues beneath the overhanging, leafy boughs.

<458hp 246m 191mv> 
Before an Old Carriage House
  The overgrown carriageway comes to an end here, at the doors of a wooden
carriage house, just to the south.  The building was once painted red, but
has now faded and flaked to a pinkish-brown.  Many of the tiles of its
triangular roof have slipped, and lie scattered on the ground, and the whole
structure looks slightly lopsided.  A trickling stream of water flows under
the front doors, into the building.  To the west a cobbled footpath begins,
and winds around the side of the carriage house, toward the grounds of the
mansion.  

[Exits: north (south) west]
A shady-looking bandit slouches along, dressed in crude leather armour.
A shaggy, red-furred kankoran picks his teeth with a sharp claw.
A hunched, sly-looking kankoran leans on the wall, grinning wolfishly.

<458hp 246m 190mv> 
w
In the Shadow of a Buttressed Wall
  A path of white pebbles winds through some bramble-choked flower gardens
here, beneath the elegant row of arches which support the high western wall.
Clearly the wall of some great hall, it is lined with high, stained glass
windows, spaced between the buttresses.  The northern wall is lower, its
second story crumbled to ruin, and a leering gargoyle squats on its brink. 
To the east the path joins with a wider carriage-way, while to the south it
meanders into an overgrown garden.  

[Exits: east south]

<458hp 246m 189mv> 
s
An Overgrown Garden
  A weed-ridden path of white pebbles winds its way from the north, before
turning westward.  On either side of the path the garden grows rampant. 
Veils of sprawling creeper, both red Nendorian woodbine and green ivy, drape
from a few ornamental elm trees, while completely shrouding several smaller
shrubs.  The garden continues in all directions but the east, where the wall
of an old, wooden building rises.  

[Exits: north south west]

<458hp 246m 188mv> 
s
By an Old Oak Tree
  A magnificent oak tree spreads its limbs over this part of the garden,
shading the acorn-scattered ground with its thick foliage.  The creepers and
vines, so thick to the north, still cover some of the ground here, and climb
up the lower parts of the oak's trunk.  However a new invader is beginning
to drive back the ivy - thick growths of blackberry rise in an impenetrable
wall to the south, and sprawl over a dilapidated carriage house to the east,
their strangling tendrils stretching out toward the oak.  To the west the
ground seems to have been cleared somewhat.  

[Exits: north west]
A swarthy, sallow-faced man stands in the shadows.
A shady-looking bandit slouches along, dressed in crude leather armour.

A Clearing in the Garden
  A part of the garden has been cleared and flattened here, forming a wide
circle of bare ground.  Ivy and blackberries have been hacked and burned,
and several beautiful trees have recently been felled.  They now lie in a
pile which blocks the way west.  However a few slender birch trees still
stand to the south, and from these some crude canvas shelters have been
strung.  In the center of the clearing a large fire burns warmly.

Beneath the Southern Mansion Wall
  A path of white pebbles, muddy and overgrown, passes beneath the
southern-most wall of the mansion here.  The high stone wall is supported by

continues east and west, while to the south an area of the garden has been

Upon Marshy Ground
  The puddles and streams of this miniature swamp are fed from the north,
where a spring-fed fountain gushes into a trickling stream.  The waters
spread out to cover much of the ground here, creating a muddy area, studded
with deep, murky puddles.  Only a few spindley gorse bushes grow from the
sodden ground, their small, yellow flowers doing little to liven the area. 

The puddles are fed from a broken fountain to the north, which burbles
between the western forest and the looming mansion to the northeast.  To the
south a large willow grows, and a pebbly path climbs out of the marsh to
wind eastward.  

[Exits: north east south]
A filthy srryn squats in the mud, claws gripping a crude club.
A wiry srryn, clad in hides, leans against a gorse bush.

In the Branches of an Old Oak Tree
  The heavy boughs of this old oak stretch outward from a common point at
the top of the trunk, forming a comfortable perch in the middle.  The tree
is quite tall, and a view of much of the garden can be had from here.  You
can even see beyond the blackberry bushes to the south, where a small,
wooden structure stands, a stream of smoke wafting from its chimney.  A
large nest of woven twigs sits between a pair of forking limbs higher up.  

You can climb straight down to the ground from here, or eastward along a
tree limb to the roof of the carriage house.  

[Exits: east down]

<458hp 246m 190mv> 
e
On the Carriage House Roof
  The crumbling roof of the carriage house is layered in mouldering wooden
tiles, many of which look ready to give way.  With little effort a passage
could be cleared to the interior of the carriage house.  The only other safe
egress is via a thick tree limb which stretches all the way to the edge of
the roof from a nearby oak to the west.

<458hp 246m 189mv> An Old Carriage House
  This simple wooden structure is designed to hold both carriage and
horses, though the two stalls for the latter stand empty.  The carriage
house is all of wood, with an earthen floor, and seems termite ridden and
fragile.  Several wooden tiles from the roof have come loose, leaving large
gaps in some places.  A thin stream of water flows beneath the large, double
doors to the north, through the carriage house, and beneath a furrow under
the southern wall.

An Old Carriage House
  This simple wooden structure is designed to hold both carriage and
horses, though the two stalls for the latter stand empty.  The carriage
house is all of wood, with an earthen floor, and seems termite ridden and
fragile.  Several wooden tiles from the roof have come loose, leaving large
gaps in some places.  A thin stream of water flows beneath the large, double
doors to the north, through the carriage house, and beneath a furrow under
the southern wall.

A Path Torn Through the Forest
  A wide path has been torn through the forest here, as though by the
passage of some great beast.  Shrubs are rent aside, or simply crushed in
many cases, and low-hanging branches have been ripped from trees.  To the
west, a thick stand of blackberries lies in tatters from the passage.  To
the north is the rear of an old, wooden building, which seems to have been
the origin of the destruction, as a great hole gapes in the wall, and
shattered wood is strewn across the forest floor.  To the south, somewhat
downhill, stands another, larger wooden building.  A similar hole opens in
its northern wall.

<458hp 246m 195mv> A Junk-Filled Storeroom
  The rear room of this caretaker's cottage has been converted to a storage
room for junk.  A few benches line the walls, and on these lie dozens of
gardening and carpentry tools, missing heads, handles, or simply rusting to
pieces.  Under the benches are stacked a large array of pots, buckets, and
barrels.  In one corner, surrounding an old cupboard, lies a pile of strange
mechanical devices - metallic frames crammed with cogs, levers and gears. 
Most seem to be broken, their former functions indecipherable.

A Collapsed Room

By the Doors of an Old Mansion

The Entrance Hall
  Once splendidly appointed, this large entrance chamber is now in a state
of ruin and decay.  Wooden beams from the high, exposed roof hang
precariously from their sockets, now forming perches for the birds of the
forest, which come and go through the broken stained-glass windows. 
Girdling the southern half of the room is a wide balcony -- now unreachable,
as its wooden staircase has long since collapsed, blocking a door in the
eastern wall.  Several clocks, of different shapes and sizes, hang from the
plaster walls about the chamber, or lie toppled in the debris of the floor. 

Double doors are set in both the north and south walls, while in the western
wall the door has fallen from its hinges, and a faint, tinkling music comes
from the room beyond.

<458hp 246m 195mv> The Entrance Hall
  Once splendidly appointed, this large entrance chamber is now in a state
of ruin and decay.  Wooden beams from the high, exposed roof hang
precariously from their sockets, now forming perches for the birds of the
forest, which come and go through the broken stained-glass windows. 
Girdling the southern half of the room is a wide balcony -- now unreachable,
as its wooden staircase has long since collapsed, blocking a door in the
eastern wall.  Several clocks, of different shapes and sizes, hang from the
plaster walls about the chamber, or lie toppled in the debris of the floor. 

Double doors are set in both the north and south walls, while in the western
wall the door has fallen from its hinges, and a faint, tinkling music comes
from the room beyond.  

[Exits: (north) (east) south west up]

A Dusty Sitting Room
  The curving wall of the tower cuts through this room to the northwest,
giving it an odd, almost-triangular shape.  It is efficiently furnished as a
comfortable sitting room, with a couple of divans and a single armchair
arranged about the walls, all covered in dusty white sheets.  Against the
narrow segment of the northern wall, in the nook formed between the tower
and the eastern wall, is set a beautiful, gilded harpsichord.  A tinkling
music streams from the instrument, and its keys depress and rise again, as
though at the hands of an invisible musician.  

An open doorway leads to a large chamber to the east, and a closed doorway
to the south.

Beneath a Bluestone Tower
  A high bluestone tower rises from the northwest corner of the mansion,
just to your south.  Its jutting battlements perch well above the canopy of
the forest, some score feet higher than the decaying roof of the mansion. 
The tower itself seems to be in better repair than the rest of the mansion. 
Its dark, blue-grey stone is less weathered than the granite blocks of the
mansion proper, but more obviously - it seems to be free of the ivy which
shrouds the rest of the building.  The surrounding forest grows thickly up
to the western edge of the tower, also blocking travel to the north.  The
mansion's front door lies to the east.

<458hp 246m 189mv> 
A Rutted Carriageway
  A rutted carriageway winds north and south here, between the trees of
Nendor forest.  Once cobbled with flat, white stones, the path is now badly
overgrown.  The stones are now pushed askew by grasses and saplings, or lie
buried in the mud which crowds in from the edges.  The leafy boughs of the
tall, slender trees hang over the carriage-way, forming a light tunnel.  To
the north the path passes some old gate posts, while to the south the trees
give way, revealing an ivy-covered manor house.  

[Exits: north south]

<458hp 246m 188mv> 
n
By the Ivy-Covered Gate Posts
  The old carriageway continues south, passing between a pair of old,
stone gateposts.  The posts are of mortared bluestone blocks, roughly hewn,
and built into pinnacles some six feet high.  The gates themselves have long
since vanished, and all that remains of them are the heavy iron hinges,
bolted to the stone.  Thick ivy covers the gateposts, and the surrounding
shrubs almost completely obscure their presence.  To the south the path
continues through the trees, while on the northern side of the posts it
turns sharply west.  

[Exits: north south]

  This trail winds its way southward, through the downland south of Var
Bandor, toward the Forest of Nendor.  The edges of the dirt path are lined

<458hp 246m 188mv> 
Inside the Southern Gatehouse
  The southern gatehouse of Var Bandor is an elaborate affair,
well-maintained and proper.  A close watch is kept on the kind of traveler
allowed to enter the finest districts of the city, and a roster of those
banned from the area is kept nearby.  The immense granite walls rise to
either side of the gates, and to the south, the outskirts of Var Bandor run
into a thickly wooded area.  North, Ilrin Street leads into the heart of the
city.  

[Exits: north south]

A soldier of the Var Bandor Guard watches the gatehouse.

<458hp 246m 187mv> 
n
Ilrin Street
  A wide street composed of black stones and carefully-arranged curbs,
Ilrin Street runs the length of southern Var Bandor, winding among the
gloriously rich houses of the merchants and the eccentrically constructed
towers of the scholars.  Here and there, baskets of flowers hang from the
sides of buildings, and hired servants tend to shaped shrubs.  The streets
in the southern part of town are swept clean, and all animal traffic is
prohibited.  To the east, Arcanos Street leads to the scholars' towers.  

[Exits: north east south]
An enforcer of Var Bandor patrols here, scrutinizing every passing face.

north, the Dantaron river splits into two forks which flow around Var Bandor
on either side.  To the east, a large docking area has been built alongside
the river's murky waters.  The docks are humming with activity, merchants
overseeing the offloading of their goods, travelers disembarking, and
citizens of Var Bandor milling about.

Outside the Northern Gatehouse
  The towering gates of Var Bandor rise to the south.  Huge, heavy wooden
doors reinforced with iron bars, the gates are maintained rigorously.  The
walls to the east and west are solid stone, with murder slits.  To the
north, the river Dantaron splits into two mighty forks which flow by Var
Bandor on either side.

<438hp 230m 168mv> 
s
Inside the Northern Gatehouse
  This gatehouse house is built behind the gates of Sadrent, the oldest of
the gates into Var Bandor.  Outside, to the north, a ferry leads across the
Dantaron river, while to the south Sadrent road snakes its way into the
city.  The gatehouse is ill-tended, leading in to the poorest section of the
city, and consequently little attention is paid to the traffic of riff-raff
and n'er-do-wells through these wrought iron gates.  

[Exits: north south]
A soldier of the Var Bandor Guard watches the gatehouse.

Sadrent Road
  Sadrent Road runs the length of northern Var Bandor, winding its way
through the worst parts of town.  Built on the delta when Var Bandor was
founded, the northern buildings are the oldest, and consequently have become
the slum area.  Sadrent Road itself is a wide band of filthy cobblestones
winding between the ruined buildings.  To the east and west is a squalid
alley.

<438hp 230m 157mv> 
s
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.

Ilrin Street
  A wide street composed of black stones and carefully-arranged curbs,
Ilrin Street runs the length of southern Var Bandor, winding among the
gloriously rich houses of the merchants and the eccentrically constructed
towers of the scholars.  Here and there, baskets of flowers hang from the
sides of buildings, and hired servants tend to shaped shrubs.  The streets
in the southern part of town are swept clean, and all animal traffic is
prohibited.  The Var Bandor Center Square is to the north.

Office of Applied Theology
  The office exudes an air of cold formality, dominated by sleek white

Near a Dilapidated Hut
  The overgrown path to the east and south opens here before a seemingly
abandoned hut.  Originally much like the homes of Jaras Village to the
southwest, this hut seems to have been subjected to a number of floodings. 
Its walls bow out at the bottom, and the wood of the building is stained,
cracking, and mouldering all over.  The area around here looks as if it was
once part of the village but has been overrun with plants for many years.  A
number of reptilian footprints pock the mud, giving it an uneven appearance.
The doorless frame to the east leads into the hut, and a particularly dense
wall of reeds blocks passage to the north.

A Dilapidated Hut
  The walls of this hut are almost entirely rotted through, bowing out near
the bottom.  A narrow window opens to the north, through which a number of
reeds have poked their tassled heads.  Little light filters into the room,
save from the doorframe to the west and a rather large hole in the northeast
corner of the roof.  Water drips from the hole in the roof, keeping the
uneven ground perpetually damp.  Reptilian footprints cover the mud in
small, water-filled craters, and a few body-shaped divots are sunk deep in
the mud in the northwest corner.  A boarded up door blocks passage to the
east.

<301hp 254m 192mv> 
help provoke
/---------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|          Provoke (Skill)                                                  |
\---------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Activation lag  :  1.5 rounds
Activation cost :  0 mana


Syntax: Provoke
        Provoke all

This skill attempts to provoke others into combat with the user, traditionally
by insulting someone's mother but the skill does not specify and so one's
imagination may fly free. Using the 'all' argument will divert all ungrouped
combatants onto the user at once. Unlike rescue, one provokes the enemy, not
one's ally.

The brave trait will improve the chance of succeeding at this skill.


See also: RESCUE, DISTRACT, AUTOASSIST, AUTOATTACK
A young srryn has some big nasty wounds and scratches.

A Marshy Plot, Overrun by Reeds
  This area of the marsh is entirely covered by assorted grass, weeds, and
plantlife.  A few random stones are buried in the mud here, creating small
pockets of space where the plants do not intrude.  A small, ramshackle house
with a wild rosebush clinging to its mouldering surface stands to the east. 
The mass of plantlife here thins slightly to the north, giving way to a
small yet passable path.  The marsh continues southward.  

[Exits: north east south west]

n
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
An Opening in the Reeds
  A veritable wall of reeds encircles this area, breaking in a number of
spots where footpaths have been tramped through them.  The ground is damp
yet well-packed, allowing a smooth yet slick passage for adventurers on
foot.  A few paths through the reeds branch off here, one leading toward the
lake northward and another heading toward a pair of ramshackle huts
eastward.  A path toward the village leads off to the west, while a wild
mass of plantlife is south of here.

A Half-Overgrown Path
  This path looks as if it has been used recently, but only to the lightest
extent.  Spiked weeds overrun the packed dirt here, giving the land an
overly inhospitable feel.  The air reeks of dampness and decay, the source
of which is the rotting house to the south.  A few vines clambor across the
side of the rotting house, appearing to be the only thing which holds them
together.  An overgrown path leads to the north and east, toward a pair of
broken-down huts.  Westward, a break in the reeds offers offers a view
toward a well-kept fishing village.  

[Exits: north east west]

/---------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|          Kyana the Defiant, Goddess of the Stars                          |
\---------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Favored Lineage     Chaja
Element(s)          Spirit
Home(s)             In a Field of Stars
Alignment           Neutral Good
Symbol(s)           The stars, a candle
Values              Perseverance, prophecy, defiance, sympathy, suffering,
                    comfort
Worshippers         The oppressed, revolutionaries, seers, counselors

The oldest goddess of the pantheon outside of the Overgods, Kyana is the
ancient and wise goddess of the stars and steward of the astral realms.

Those who find Kyana's favor are marked with the Sigil of the Stars.

A Dilapidated Hut
  The walls of this hut are almost entirely rotted through, bowing out near
the bottom.  A narrow window opens to the north, through which a number of
reeds have poked their tassled heads.  Little light filters into the room,
save from the doorframe to the west and a rather large hole in the northeast
corner of the roof.  Water drips from the hole in the roof, keeping the
uneven ground perpetually damp.  Reptilian footprints cover the mud in
small, water-filled craters, and a few body-shaped divots are sunk deep in
the mud in the northwest corner.  A boarded up door blocks passage to the
east.

recall
North Wall of the Temple of Darkness
  Earendam's temple of darkness is an architectural hybrid, blending the
classical Republican forms with the statuery of Yithoul and the intricate
carvings of the Srryn.  The temple is topped by a barrel-vaulted roof, which
leads from the southern entrance towards the altar which sits here against
the north wall.  Supporting the ceiling are a series of onyx columns, whose
intricate carvings serve to frame a set of statues in marble, forming a sort
of gallery along the east and west walls.  The altar here is made from
carved ebony, cunningly crafted with the symbols of the order which tends
this temple.  Set on the altar are smoldering censers, which fill the
surrounding air with the smell of myrrh.

<299hp 262m 99mv> Kaagn Row
  Kaagn row heads east and west along the north banks of the Dantaron, a
road paved with well-worn cobblestones hewn from the Brintors.  Pylons block
off the way to the south, except where a high arched wooden bridge splits
off from the road to cross the Dantaron.  The entirety of the north side of
the street is taken up with a temple of blocks carved from obsidian.  Tall
black steps lead up to the entrance, which is framed by columns, which have
all been carved into complicated piece of statuery.  The tall columns give
the building a gigantic feel, and it seems to tower over the entire street.

The Mouth of the Dantaron
  The wide mouth of the Dantaron empties at this point into the calm, gray
waters of Earendam Harbor as the river passes through the port of Earendam. 
The smell of saltwater fills the air, and the cries of gulls mix with the
clamor of men.  Far to the west the walls of Earendam are still barely

recall
North Wall of the Temple of Darkness
  Earendam's temple of darkness is an architectural hybrid, blending the
classical Republican forms with the statuery of Yithoul and the intricate
carvings of the Srryn.  The temple is topped by a barrel-vaulted roof, which
leads from the southern entrance towards the altar which sits here against
the north wall.  Supporting the ceiling are a series of onyx columns, whose
intricate carvings serve to frame a set of statues in marble, forming a sort
of gallery along the east and west walls.  The altar here is made from
carved ebony, cunningly crafted with the symbols of the order which tends
this temple.  Set on the altar are smoldering censers, which fill the
surrounding air with the smell of myrrh.  

[Exits: east south]

  Earendam's temple of darkness is an architectural hybrid, blending the

<327hp 262m 48mv> Kaagn Row
  Kaagn row heads east and west along the north banks of the Dantaron, a
road paved with well-worn cobblestones hewn from the Brintors.  Pylons block
off the way to the south, except where a high arched wooden bridge splits
off from the road to cross the Dantaron.  The entirety of the north side of
the street is taken up with a temple of blocks carved from obsidian.  Tall
black steps lead up to the entrance, which is framed by columns, which have
all been carved into complicated piece of statuery.  The tall columns give
the building a gigantic feel, and it seems to tower over the entire street.

The Dantaron River
  The placid waters of the Dantaron make their way through the city of
Earendam.  Passing between the city's mercantile district to the north, and
the old city to the south, the river is one of the principal avenues for
trade into and out of the city.  The waters of the Dantaron are deep here,
clouded by the dark mud of its bottom, and the frequent river-traffic along
its course.  To the east, the Dantaron flows under a high arched bridge. 
Westward, it flows towards its egress from the city's walls.

By the Earendam Docks
  The Dantaron River flows from the plains to the east, making its way
under the city wall of Earendam to the west, and eventually to the Uthlin
Ocean.  To the north and south the river is lined with the Earendam docks
area, bustling with merchants unloading cargo and passengers disembarking
from barges.  Narrow wooden walkways run from one dock to the next, passing
just overhead.

u
The Earendam Docks
  A wide wooden docks has been erected just to the north of the River
Dantaron, flowing sluggishly to the south under the city wall.  The docks
are clear of clutter, incoming cargo being regulated closely and required to
move immediately.  An occasional raft or barge can be seen on the river,
arriving or leaving the city.  Several ladders and wooden walkways lead
downward to the water of the river itself.

<442hp 262m 209mv> The West Gate of Earendam
  Earendam's west gates are made of sturdy iron, built between two tall

The Western Arien Plaza
  The Arien Plaza comes to an end here as it approaches the western gate of
Earendam.  Travelers and merchants head out through this gate onto the
Arien road, bringing goods to and from the lands to the west.  Set in the
northwestern portion of the city, this plaza is a square ringed on all
sides by the buildings and walls of New Earendam.  Paved with cobblestones
long worn smooth by the feet of travelers entering the city from the Arien
road, the center of the square lies eastward, where an ornate fountain
serves as a resting place for the main body of the populace in the immediate
area.  Shops line the northern edge of the square, while southward the plaza
eventually terminates in a stone wall.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A hulking alatharya porter carries goods for a merchant.
A merchant from Var Bandor strolls through the plaza.

e
<430hp 251m 196mv> 
The Center of Arien Plaza
  The Arien plaza stretches in all directions around this point.  From
here, you can make out the locations on the periphery of this almost
perfectly square plaza.  Travelers head to and from a gate to the west,
filling the square with merchants and others, passing through the city by
way of the Arien road.  Further east, the square eventually leads to the
eastern portion of the city, while a similar passage cuts through a wall a
ways to the south.  The north wall of the plaza is dominated by a series of
shops and taverns, mainly devoted to providing for the merchants who pass
through here.  The exact center of the plaza houses a sizeable granite
fountain, its circular base surrounding a pool whose water source is a
statue of tall caladaran.  The cobblestone ground of the plaza bears shows
many signs of wear and use, the fountain being a popular gathering place for
merchants newly arrived in the city.  A small, square grate sits at the
eastern side of the base of the fountain.  

[Exits: north east south west (down)]
A muscular protector is loitering here, surveying the area casually.

The Northern Arien Plaza
  The northern half of the Arien Plaza bustles with activity as merchants
and travelers pass through the plaza to and from the west gate of the city,
which lies to the southwest.  The plaza continues in every direction except
the north, where an open shop front advertises provisions for passing
travellers.  Of particular note is the center of the plaza to the south,
where a statue and fountain are visible.

<430hp 251m 194mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Jalith's Provisions
  Jalith's shop provides provisions to the travellers coming to and from
the plaza along the Arien road.  Crowded with barrels of flour, along with
jars of preserved meats and other spices, the shop does a brisk enough
business to demand that these supplies be on hand.  A stone building with a
wooden ceiling, the shop is built in the more modern mercantile style which
dominates this party of the city, known colloquially as "New Earendam."  

[Exits: south]
Jalith stands here, offering provisions for sale.

Anteroom of the Arien Way
  This small hallway serves as the anteroom for the Arien Way, a popular
tavern in this part of Earendam.  Covered in panelled pine, the walls of the
hallway narrow in a doorway to the north, leading to the interior of the
tavern.  Covering the floor of the anteroom is a tiled mosaic, depicting the
traditional sign of a tavern, made using colored stones from the Brintors. 
The streets of Arien plaza are to the south.

The Common Room of the Arien Way
  The common room of the Arien Way is a large square chamber, panelled with
planks of scented pines.  Filled with tables and the smoke of the torches
which illuminate the chamber, this room is a common gathering place for the
merchants who frequent the Arien Plaza.  The room's decor seems to be a cut
above the typical tavern, with the occasional painting adorning the walls,
and a simple tile mosaic covering the floor.  An exit lies to a hallway to
the east, and the bar is further west of here.

| * Avendar is an early modern-era fantasy roleplaying game.               |
| * Real life names are allowed, but references to real people are not.    |

| * Unusual capitalization, such as MacDugal or a'Ganylosha, is allowed.   |
| * Surnames may contain spaces; be reasonable about it.                   |
| * For more detailed information and examples, read HELP NAME.            |

/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|                        The Lineages of Avendar                           |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/
/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
| Human:     Gregarious and flexible, known as great empire-builders.      |
| Aelin:     Slight with feathered wings, known for their grace and pride. |
| Alatharya: Giants with silvery skin, the First People cannot use magic.  |
| Caladaran: Sagely, tree-like people famed for their monastic traditions. |
| Chaja:     Caprine and reclusive giants with wooly hair and small horns. |
| Ch'taren:  Curious and alien beings the golden hue of their auras.       |
| Ethron:    Small, amphibious plant-loving people with colourful skin.    |
| Nefortu:   Chiropteran people known for their cunning and alacrity.      |
| Shuddeni:  Eyeless subterranean marsupials connected to demonkind.       |
| Srryn:     Bipedal reptiles known for adaptability and territoriality.   |
|                                                                          |
| All lineages are physically humanoid but different species. Hybrids do   |
| not exist. All characters roll up at the age of mental and physical      |
| maturity for their lineage, which may vary between species.              |
|                                                                          |
| Each lineage will have different innate traits (such as flight or        |
| darkvision) and a different spread of maximum statistics. For more       |
| information, including a table of max stats, see HELP STATISTICS.        |

Select your lineage (help for more information)? [Hit Return to continue]
chaja
chaja
/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|                                  Chaja                                   |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/
/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
| Most chaja communities live in isolated strongholds in the Brintor       |
| mountains, ordering their lives by the stars.  Owing to this isolation,  |
| chaja are most widely known across Avendar for their use by the shuddeni |
| as slaves, particularly during the War of Night.  Chaja are caprine      |
| giants with wooly hair covering most of their bodies, uniformly pale     |
| eyes, and small, nubby horns.  They are nearly as tall as the alatharya, |
| but have rounder, softer bodies with little muscle definition.  Their    |
| size allows them to wield two-handed weapons in a single hand.  They     |
| can see in darkness, and may safely eat nearly anything.  For more       |
| information, read HELP CHAJA.                                            |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Are you sure this is the lineage you wish to choose? 
y

/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|                                  Gender                                  |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/

| You may choose the gender of your character during creation.  We allow   |
| characters to create as neutral-gender; the pronoun 'they' will be used  |
| for such characters.                                                     |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/

/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|                        The Professions of Avendar                        |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/
/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
| Warriors:    Uses brute force or combat expertise to their advange.      |
|              Includes fighters, swordmasters, and gladiators.            |
| Rogues:      Rely on stealth, concealment, and cunning to achieve their  |
|              goals. Includes thieves, bandits, and bards.                |
| Scholars:    Mages who are schooled in elemental magic. They may study   |
|              the spheres of Fire, Water, Earth, Air, Spirit, or Void.    |
| Templars:    Spellswords who forgo mastery to blend their talents. They  |
|              study one of the six elemental spheres.                     |
| Naturalists: Devotees of the wild who are strongest outdoors. Includes   |
|              rangers, barbarians, and druids.                            |
| Mentalists:  Disciples of the mind who learn psionic abilities. Includes |
|              assassins, watchers, and psionicists.                       |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Select an available profession from those listed below.
 [Scholar Templar Rogue Warrior Naturalist Mentalist ]: 
templar

/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|                          The Spheres of Magic                            |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/
/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
| Water:  The magic of protection, healing, frost and tide. Opposes Chaos, |
|         Evil, and Fire.                                                  |
| Fire:   The power of thermal energy, destruction and rage. Opposes Law,  |
|         Good, and Earth.                                                 |
| Earth:  Manipulation of gravity, strength, and stone. Opposes Chaos and  |
|         Air.                                                             |
| Air:    Control of illusion, electricity, and randomness. Opposes Law    |
|         and Spirit.                                                      |
| Spirit: Command of light, positive energy, and the Weave. Opposes Law,   |
|         Evil, and Void.                                                  |
| Void:   Conjuration of demonkind, negative energy, and terror. Opposes   |
|         Chaos, Good, and Water.                                          |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/
***Scholars SHOULD NOT choose Earth, Air, or Spirit. These classes are not
supported presently and are not fully functional.***

You must now pick your major sphere.

Valid choices are: [ Water Spirit Earth Air Void Fire ]

/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|                        The Lineages of Avendar                           |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/
/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
| Human:     Gregarious and flexible, known as great empire-builders.      |
| Aelin:     Slight with feathered wings, known for their grace and pride. |
| Alatharya: Giants with silvery skin, the First People cannot use magic.  |
| Caladaran: Sagely, tree-like people famed for their monastic traditions. |
| Chaja:     Caprine and reclusive giants with wooly hair and small horns. |
| Ch'taren:  Curious and alien beings the golden hue of their auras.       |
| Ethron:    Small, amphibious plant-loving people with colourful skin.    |
| Nefortu:   Chiropteran people known for their cunning and alacrity.      |
| Shuddeni:  Eyeless subterranean marsupials connected to demonkind.       |
| Srryn:     Bipedal reptiles known for adaptability and territoriality.   |
|                                                                          |
| All lineages are physically humanoid but different species. Hybrids do   |
| not exist. All characters roll up at the age of mental and physical      |
| maturity for their lineage, which may vary between species.              |
|                                                                          |
| Each lineage will have different innate traits (such as flight or        |
| darkvision) and a different spread of maximum statistics. For more       |
| information, including a table of max stats, see HELP STATISTICS.        |

Select your lineage (help for more information)? [Hit Return to continue]
chaja
chaja
/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|                                  Chaja                                   |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/
/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
| Most chaja communities live in isolated strongholds in the Brintor       |
| mountains, ordering their lives by the stars.  Owing to this isolation,  |
| chaja are most widely known across Avendar for their use by the shuddeni |
| as slaves, particularly during the War of Night.  Chaja are caprine      |
| giants with wooly hair covering most of their bodies, uniformly pale     |
| eyes, and small, nubby horns.  They are nearly as tall as the alatharya, |
| but have rounder, softer bodies with little muscle definition.  Their    |
| size allows them to wield two-handed weapons in a single hand.  They     |
| can see in darkness, and may safely eat nearly anything.  For more       |
| information, read HELP CHAJA.                                            |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Are you sure this is the lineage you wish to choose? 
y

| characters to create as neutral-gender; the pronoun 'they' will be used  |
| for such characters.                                                     |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/

/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|                        The Professions of Avendar                        |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/
/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
| Warriors:    Uses brute force or combat expertise to their advange.      |
|              Includes fighters, swordmasters, and gladiators.            |
| Rogues:      Rely on stealth, concealment, and cunning to achieve their  |
|              goals. Includes thieves, bandits, and bards.                |
| Scholars:    Mages who are schooled in elemental magic. They may study   |
|              the spheres of Fire, Water, Earth, Air, Spirit, or Void.    |
| Templars:    Spellswords who forgo mastery to blend their talents. They  |
|              study one of the six elemental spheres.                     |
| Naturalists: Devotees of the wild who are strongest outdoors. Includes   |
|              rangers, barbarians, and druids.                            |
| Mentalists:  Disciples of the mind who learn psionic abilities. Includes |
|              assassins, watchers, and psionicists.                       |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Select an available profession from those listed below.
 [Scholar Templar Rogue Warrior Naturalist Mentalist ]: 
warrior

/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|                              Warrior Classes                             |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/
/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
| Fighter:     Soldiers and mercenaries trained by one of Avendar's city   |
|              militias, who focus on formations and phalanxes.            |
| Swordmaster: Students of the ancient ak'anginta, they devote themselves  |
|              entirely to the sword, becoming their unrivaled masters.    |
| Gladiator:   Pit-fighters trained in showy combat techniques, they are   |
|              as charismatic as they are deadly.                          |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/

Available classes are: 
 [ fighter swordmaster gladiator ] (or 'back' to choose again)

|                                Alignment                                 |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/
/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
| You must designate an alignment for your character during the creation   |
| process.  While this is primarily a roleplay device, the alignments      |
| available to you are dependent on your race and class selection.  During |
| play, your alignment may help or hinder you when gaining experience.     |
| More information on individual alignments is available in our tutorial   |
| area.                                                                    |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/
