/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|                                  Ethos                                   |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/
/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
| In addition to alignment, you must also designate an ethos for your new  |
| character.  This is a roleplay device which acts as a modifier on the    |
| alignment you have chosen.  The ethoi available to you is dependent upon |
| your race and class selection.  Additional information on particular     |
| ethos and alignment combinations is in our tutorial area.                |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/

/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|                                Hometowns                                 |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/
/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
| During the creation process, you must specify a location which your      |
| character considers home.  There are a number of cities, towns, and      |
| settlements to choose from.  Some locations are more accessible, while   |
| others have special bonuses or features.  When you die, your character's |
| ghost will reappear at an altar in their hometown.                       |

| is the last step in character creation; please remember to keep 3 of     |

|                              Name Guidelines                             |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/
/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
| * Avendar is an early modern-era fantasy roleplaying game.               |
| * Real life names are allowed, but references to real people are not.    |
| * All character names must be unique and may not reference other         |
|   settings or works of fiction outside Avendar.                          |
| * For more detailed information and examples, see HELP NAME.             |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/

/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
|                           Surname Guidelines                             |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/
/--------------------------------------------------------------------------\
| * Surnames may be chosen at creation, but are not required.              |
| * Refer to the same general rules as a given name.                       |
| * Unusual capitalization, such as MacDugal or a'Ganylosha, is allowed.   |
| * Surnames may contain spaces; be reasonable about it.                   |
| * For more detailed information and examples, read HELP NAME.            |
\--------------------------------------------------------------------------/

background

The following background traits are available:

aristocrat: When you have matured some, you will be granted an inheritance from your estate. (2
trains)
streetwise: A life spent growing up on the streets has left you wise to many common tricks. (2
trains)
thieves cant: You know the silent hand signal language of thieves. (1 train)
mortician: You are quite skilled at dismembering and dissecting corpses. (1 train)
loremaster: You have studied extensively, and have a mastery of rare lore and esoterica. (1 train)
forger: You have studied and practiced various methods of forgery. (1 train)

fleet: You are able to grab fallen weapons in combat. (1 train)
hollow leg: You can eat more than most before you get full. (1 train)
long-lived: You're likely to have a longer than average lifespan. (1 train)
survivor: You have a firm grasp on the material world, and will resist your final death longer than
others. (1 train)
light sleeper: You can sense nearby activity while sleeping. (1 train)

Welcome!  If you are new to MUDs, you may want to read "help starting".  

The Beginning
  The School of Heroes is hidden in a remote valley in the Yagash
Mountains, and the cold bite of high elevation swirls around you under a
perpetually overcast sky.  Gilded symbols of the gods Dolgrael, Lilune, and
Jolinn have been lovingly sculpted into massive doors of dark basalt that
lock fast behind you.  There is no way back; only forward.  

Whether due to triumph or tragedy, a drive to desperate heroism or sadistic
villainy, you have come to this remote place and secured your adventurer's
license from the School of Heroes.  You have completed your official
training and registration and stand now before the Tower of Testing, where
your final practical examinations await you.  

You may leave through the portals connected to different towns on the
continent of Avendar in the Tower of Testing ahead, but you are encouraged
to proceed with your practical examination, as it will impart many valuable
skills and items for your life ahead.  

[OOC: Welcome to Avendar!  You may type HELP to access our help system
and the NEWBIE channel is available to request out-of-character
assistance from staff or other players.]

[Exits: north]
Type "newbie" if you wish to enable the global new players channel.

Before the Gates of the School of Heroes
  Before you stand the gates of the School of Heroes, the renowned center
of training for young adventurers.  It is an enormous structure, composed of
marble, stone, and brick, and has been built upon a rocky hill.  The gates
are forged of wrought iron, and remain open to travelers of every size,
affiliation, and creed.  The central foyer of the School lies ahead, the
marble edifice looming over its well-worn gates.  A small courtyard opens
here, with a beautiful central fountain and a circle of low bushes.  

[Exits: north south]
     A beautiful golden fountain gushes water.

<100hp 100m 99mv> 
s
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Portal Chamber
  This cubical room is made from blocks of hewn marble.  Benches of similar
stone are set diagonally against the corners of the room, and an open
skylight provides illumination from above.  However, this room is unique in
that it contains four magical gateways which connect the School of Heroes to
various locations in Avendar.  Each glowing with soft blue light, the three
vertical portals are set into the eastern, western, and southern walls.  The
fourth portal is horizontal and circular, and is set into the floor directly
beneath the skylight.  A more mundane doorway leads north, to the courtyard
before the entrance to the School proper.  

[Exits: north east south west down]
(Translucent) A magic mouth hovers in mid-air, grinning nonchalantly.
The magic mouth tells you, 'Are you sure you're ready to leave the School?'
The magic mouth tells you, 'If you're ready, then you're ready...'
The magic mouth tells you, 'If you want to know about the portal destinations, say the name of the
direction you want to go.'

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Temple of Balance
  An ancient temple, this place is built in a magnificent style, calling to
mind the grandest stages of classical architecture in Earendam.  Gentle
stone steps lead across the south of the room to an altar of deep brown
marble.  Carved above the altar is the lemniscate, traditional symbol of an
ancient order of priests devoted to the forces of balance in the universe. 
On either side of the altar stand twin statues, one made from carved ivory,
the other of midnight-black onyx.  The chambers ends to the north, where a
high doorway leads out to the street.  

[Exits: north down]
(White Aura) An ancient healer tends the altar of balance.

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Side Street
  Paved with cobblestones from the Brintors, this side street runs through
the old city, connecting Qalnistra Street to the west with the magnificent
Temple of the Crown, which lies eastward.  One building stands out along the
way here, magnificently built even for the architecture of the old city. 
Ivy grows across its marble pillars, and quartz steps lead into it to the
south.  Elsewhere, the backs of buildings loom over the north side of the
street, shading the cobblestones of the way.  

[Exits: east south west]

Before the Golden Stairway
  The cobbled streets of Earendam open into a plaza of carefully-laid
marble tiles, so skillfully executed that it is difficult to find the seams
of the stone squares.  To the east, a broad stairway, its sixty-foot wide
steps inlaid with gold, rises gradually above the level of the street.  At
its zenith, the fabulous spires of the Temple of the Crown blaze in the sun.

  South Valvaria street comes ends here, making a turn to the west as it

East Qalnistra Street
  This street runs east and west through Old Earendam, cutting a precise
line through the buildings and side streets which line the way.  Paved with
polished Brintor stones, the well-tended street nevertheless shows signs of
age, having carried the weights of both the traditions and the bodies of the
city's scholars and aristocrats for time immemorial.  Here, Qalnistra is
bounded on the north by the headquarters of the Patrician's guard, and the
south by the headquarters of one of Earendam's chartered fighting companies.

East Corvandil Square
  The east part of Corvandil Square serves as a gateway to East Qalnistra
Street, allowing noblemen and the occasional guardsman access to this square
which stands astride the south gates of the city.  Longer than it is wide,
Corvandil's glazed cobblestones are bordered by a series of fountains, each
adorning one corner of the square.  West of here is the central part of the
square, where an enormous marble statue towers above the square.

Center of Corvandil Square
  Near the center of Corvandil Square, this area is dominated by a marble
statue of epic proportions.  Standing over ten feet in height, the statue
depicts the city's first ruling Patrician, Corvandil, clad in the regalia of
an Earendam's nobility.  Corvandil Square connects the two halves of the
southern part of Earendam, as well as providing access to the city's south
gate.  Ringing the square are ornamental fountains, each inset in a corner
of the square.

West Qalnistra Street
  Lined with the buildings which typify the styles and architecture of Old
Earendam, West Qalnistra leads west through the southern reaches of the
city.  Home to many of the city's scholars and clergy, Qalnistra serves to
connect the Corvandil Square and the South gates of Earendam to the east
with the temple of Jolinn further west.  Here, a small but ornate building
holds a company of gentlemen adventurers, chartered by the Patrician to act
as a company-in-arms.

End of Qalnistra Street
  Qalnistra Street's western extent comes to an end here, halting in the
Earendam's colossal temple of Jolinn.  Marbles steps lead up, and to the
west, passing underneath pillars which are easily thirty paces high. 
Meticulously carved and cared for, the temple is devoid of the gold and
silver ornaments found in temples to other gods, but in the frieze above the
entranceway, the characters of the bas relief are lined with diamond, and
the center depicts the sapphire spear, symbolically represented by an
enormous sapphire.  

[Exits: east west]

<100hp 100m 90mv> 
w
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Inside a Temple to Jolinn
  The interior of Earendam's temple to Jolinn is daunting in its size. 
Topped by a dome of bluish marble, the room is illuminated by the glass
oculus that breaks the surface of the roof.  Light reflects on the carved
mosaic in the floor, which depicts the precepts of Jolinn in shades of
sapphire and inlaid mother-of-pearl.  A rival even to Iandir's prevalent
religion in this city, Jolinn's temple is tended by an ancient group of
clergymen, and maintained by the city's wealthier patrons.  To the west, an
altar is set upon an illuminated dais, while alcoves lead north and south
out of this massive chamber.  

[Exits: north east south down]
(White Aura) Falcia Nilin attends to the altar of Jolinn.

Office of Applied Theology
  The office exudes an air of cold formality, dominated by sleek white
marble walls and polished floors that reflect the bright light of hanging
magelights.  The western wall features an expansive mural depicting the
liberation of Var Bandor, set before a wide, heavy desk.  The environment
feels almost sterile, both imposing and inescapable despite the large double
doors perpetually open to Dantaron street.

Dantaron Street
  Dantaron Street bisects the west half of Var Bandor, leading from Center
Square to the docks outside the western gatehouse.  Sailors and dockmen
abound in this section of the city, wandering the streets while off-duty. 
The street is composed of well-worn cobblestones, with a few broken and
missing.  To the north, a large temple constructed of fine white marble
rises over the street.  To the south is a traveller's inn.  

[Exits: north east south west]
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor patrols here.

Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A bedraggled orange tabby cat with a tattered ear and a mournful expression is here.
     A large marble fountain gurgles peacefully here.
A grey pigeon walks about tentatively, looking for scraps of food.

<100hp 100m 79mv> 
l
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A bedraggled orange tabby cat with a tattered ear and a mournful expression is here.
     A large marble fountain gurgles peacefully here.
A grey pigeon walks about tentatively, looking for scraps of food.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.

<100hp 100m 79mv> 
w
Dantaron Street
  Dantaron Street bisects the west half of Var Bandor, leading from Center
Square to the docks outside the western gatehouse.  Sailors and dockmen
abound in this section of the city, wandering the streets while off-duty. 
The street is composed of well-worn cobblestones, with a few broken and
missing.  To the east is Center Square.  

[Exits: east south west]
     A small rug of brown fur lies neatly beside the street.
Chirakka is resting on a brown fur rug.

<100hp 100m 78mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Lifalin's Bows
  Lifalin's shop is completed devoted to the craft of archery.  Bows of
stout ash are interspersed with those made from lighter yew.  Along with the
bows, several finely tooled leather quivers hold arrows of several different
varieties, all neatly arranged and fletched with light brown feathers.  The
shop has few places to sit, aside from a small chair behind the counter. 
The only exit lies to the north, onto Dantaron Street.  

[Exits: north]
A shifty-eyed vagrant stumbles along, glaring about spitefully.
Lifalin works quietly on stringing a bow.

<100hp 100m 73mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Nymph's Tears
  This tavern looks a higher class than most buildings around this area,
being clean and well kept.  The bar on the east wall is dark polished oak,
the warm gleam unmarred by scratches or scars.  Rows of clean, sparkling
glasses are set above the bar, waiting to be filled with one of the exotic
imported drinks, or some dark, frothy ale.  West is a small stage, and some
sturdy tables for the patrons to rest their drinks on, as they sit and watch
the show.  North is the door back to Aragol Street, a faint fishy odour
wafting in to mingle with the sweet scents of liquor.  

[Exits: north west]
A sandy-haired woman sits quietly at the bar.
The bartender is here, and she welcomes you with a warm smile.
A heavyset man is here, sitting on a stool and enjoying the atmosphere.
A man sits here, enjoying a mug of ale.

<100hp 100m 70mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Broad Side Street
  Leading south of Aragol Street, a broad side road leads between two
warehouses of Var Bandor.  The street is paved with granite blocks, and is
surprisingly well-maintained.  To the west rises the windowless limestone
facade of Var Bandor's prison, while to the east the a wide staircase leads
up to the Office of City Planning.  

[Exits: north]

<106hp 106m 83mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Journey's End
  The Journey's End is a nice inn, though with closer examination you note
cobwebs that would not be present if this inn were in a more reputable part
of town.  A small bar stands in one corner, but most of the hard core
drinkers will go to one of the other numerous pubs along the road.  The
innkeeper stands behind the bar, accepting coin for his rooms upstairs, and
for food and drink alike.  The inn continues to the south, with more tables
for customers to sit down and relax, and there is a small door behind the
bar leading to the innkeeper's personal room.  North is the door back to the
bustle of Dantaron Road.  

[Exits: north (east) south]
The innkeeper bustles around the room, a warm welcoming smile on his round face.
A woman sits here, enjoying the peace of the inn.
A patron of the inn sits here, enjoying a fine meal.
A young boy sits here, spinning a brightly coloured top.

The Boatseller's
  The boatsellers shop is big out of necessity, the boats out for people to
buy taking up a large amount of space.  The shop seems in good repair, and
the boats you can examine are all well put together, and seem like quality
workmanship.  The only exit is to the north, where the Dantaron Road runs
along.

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Sadrent Road
  Sadrent Road runs the length of northern Var Bandor, winding its way
through the worst parts of town.  Built on the delta when Var Bandor was
founded, the northern buildings are the oldest, and consequently have become
the slum area.  Sadrent Road itself is a wide band of filthy cobblestones
winding between the ruined buildings.  To the south is the central square of
Var Bandor.

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Inside the Northern Gatehouse
  This gatehouse house is built behind the gates of Sadrent, the oldest of
the gates into Var Bandor.  Outside, to the north, a ferry leads across the
Dantaron river, while to the south Sadrent road snakes its way into the
city.  The gatehouse is ill-tended, leading in to the poorest section of the
city, and consequently little attention is paid to the traffic of riff-raff
and n'er-do-wells through these wrought iron gates.  

[Exits: north south]
A soldier of the Var Bandor Guard watches the gatehouse.

n
<106hp 106m 64mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Outside the Northern Gatehouse
  The towering gates of Var Bandor rise to the south.  Huge, heavy wooden
doors reinforced with iron bars, the gates are maintained rigorously.  The
walls to the east and west are solid stone, with murder slits.  To the
north, the river Dantaron splits into two mighty forks which flow by Var
Bandor on either side.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<106hp 106m 63mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Outskirts of Var Bandor
  You stand outside the north wall of Var Bandor.  In the distance to the
north, the Dantaron river splits into two forks which flow around Var Bandor
on either side.  The ground here is muddy and level, with little grass
growing. Behind you to the south, the stone wall of the city overshadows
the outskirts. 

[Exits: north east south west]

<106hp 106m 62mv> 
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Ferry Station
  The waters of the Dantaron River flow placidly to the north, a muddy
brown barrier to merchants, carts, and foot travelers.  A small wooden dock
has been erected at the water's edge, and several large ferries run by
riverfolk carry passengers back and forth between the Arien Road and the
outskirts of Var Bandor.

[Exits: north south]
The ferryman stands along the river, offering to transport travelers.

The Dantaron River
  The winding Dantaron River turns to the east, flowing by the city of Var
Bandor.  The placid, muddy waters ripple gently as they run their course,
eventually leading to Earendam eastward.  The stone walls of Var Bandor
tower menacingly to the south, and north and south of the river ferry
stations have been set up.

The Splendid Temple of Ayaunj
  The grand atrium of the Splendid Temple of Ayaunj opens all sides, its
high fan-vaulted ceilings held aloft by fluted Gaaldic columns above a
resplendent golden marble floor, everything in sight glittering under a
massive, radiant Gaaldic chandelier.  Private offices and meeting rooms ring
the vast open floor on two tiers, rented by barrister-priests or visiting
merchants as they conduct every conceivable kind of business.  Spiraling
stairs lead up to the second tier and down to the basement, and guards
linger inconspicuously near every egress.

Caal Way
  Cobbles worn from extensive foot traffic, Caal Way is lined with

rises the gilded facade of the Temple of Ayaunj, heart of most of the city's

A Well-Trod Path
  The gates to the port city of Gaald are an iron-wrought work of artistry
that seem more for show than defense, featuring a stylized eagle over a
ship.  The thick granite frame and walls are encroached upon by ivy.  To the
north and east, a well-worn path curves along the outskirts of the city,
equidistant from the walls and the rocky shoreline of the Gaald peninsula. 
Through the gates to the south, the sounds of bustling commerce from the
trader houses and markets can be heard.  A less-used trail leads west, while
a sprawling estate can be spotted past tall fieldstone walls to the north.

A Rocky Peninsula
  The rocky shore here has been eroded by the wind and waves.  Deep
crevices and hollows make foot-travel difficult, but it is possible to pick
a way through.  Below the tide line, barnacles coat every surface with their
white, conical shells, and tide pools cradle abundant sea life.  Giant green
anemones blossom within the pools, pale mint-colored tentacles wafting
gently.  Tiny sculpins dart between hiding places, and small, varicolored
sea spiders graze on seaweeds.  Sea stars cling to the rock, traveling by
inches, outpaced by relatively speedy snails.  Urchins and larger sea
spiders brave the land, ranging from pools down to the estuary to the north,
where the Fortfo River meets the Sea of Lidreau.  To the northwest, a
sandbar, dotted with elephant seals, protects the estuary, and far to the
west the city walls of Gaald are visible.  Nearby to the south, more even
ground opens up to a rutted path.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A purple sea urchin scoots along.
A purple sea urchin scoots along.
A bright green mass of tentacles wafts inside a tide pool.

<176hp 132m 41mv> 
n
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Brackish Estuary
  Water churns through this shallow estuary as the relatively warm, fresh
water of the Fortfo River flows into the cold, salty tides of the Sea of
Lidreau.  Despite the water being only hip-deep at most, the currents are
powerful and unpredictable.  Seagrass sways beneath the surface, providing
hiding places for wildlife, and spike grass covers most of the sandy shore. 
Narrow paths run between makeshift driftwood bridges.  Banks of mist roll
through from the west, where a sandbar bears the brunt of Lidreau's might. 
To the north and east, the protected estuary continues.  The ground rises to
the south, becoming rockier, and the bright green discs of anemones can be
seen even from this distance.  From the southwest, the bustle of the port
town of Gaald can be faintly heard on the wind.  

[Exits: north east south west]

<176hp 132m 39mv> 
s
A Rocky Peninsula
  The rocky shore here has been eroded by the wind and waves.  Deep
crevices and hollows make foot-travel difficult, but it is possible to pick
a way through.  Below the tide line, barnacles coat every surface with their
white, conical shells, and tide pools cradle abundant sea life.  Giant green
anemones blossom within the pools, pale mint-colored tentacles wafting
gently.  Tiny sculpins dart between hiding places, and small, varicolored
sea spiders graze on seaweeds.  Sea stars cling to the rock, traveling by
inches, outpaced by relatively speedy snails.  Urchins and larger sea
spiders brave the land, ranging from pools down to the estuary to the north,
where the Fortfo River meets the Sea of Lidreau.  To the northwest, a
sandbar, dotted with elephant seals, protects the estuary, and far to the
west the city walls of Gaald are visible.  Nearby to the south, more even
ground opens up to a rutted path.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A purple sea urchin scoots along.
A purple sea urchin scoots along.
A bright green mass of tentacles wafts inside a tide pool.

A Bridge Over the Fortfo River
  A sandy ocean shore stretches to the north and south, surrounding the
beaten path that travels parallel to the shoreline a ways to the west.  Few
if any remnants of the thick oak forests to the northeast remain, replaced
instead by pebbles, shale, and fallen boulders from the towering Yagash
mountains far to the east.  A stone bridge allows a view of the Fortfo River
snaking down the Yagashes and gently curving through farmland before
traveling under the bridge and spilling into the estuary to the west.  Far
off to the southwest, a small peninsula juts forth from the shoreline, and a
small town sits atop it.  At either side of the bridge, a path is deeply
grooved and spotted with tracks of animals, people, and caravans of goods,
and stretches to the north and south.

Inside the Northern Gatehouse

Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.

Commerce Street
  Surrounded by newly constructed buildings, Commerce Street winds through
the merchant quarter of Var Bandor.  All around are signs of great wealth,

The Armorer
  The sounds of a hammer ringing as it strikes a piece of iron is the first
thing that assaults your ears as you enter the store.  You can also hear the
whishing of the bellows as it blows into the furnace to increase the heat of
the fire.  Shirts made of fine steel, leggings, sleeves, and assorted mails
of all type are all on display hanging from the walls.  Besides the forge
near the back of the store, the rest of the building looks immaculately
clean giving a sense of regality not normally associated with a smithy-type
shop.  You can exit back to the west.

Ilrin Street
  A wide street composed of black stones and carefully-arranged curbs,
Ilrin Street runs the length of southern Var Bandor, winding among the
gloriously rich houses of the merchants and the eccentrically constructed
towers of the scholars.  Here and there, baskets of flowers hang from the
sides of buildings, and hired servants tend to shaped shrubs.  The streets
in the southern part of town are swept clean, and all animal traffic is
prohibited.  To the east, Arcanos Street winds among the scholars' towers,
and to the west Commerce Street leads to the merchant quarter.

whe
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.

<205hp 140m 11mv> Before the Gates of the School of Heroes
  Before you stand the gates of the School of Heroes, the renowned center
of training for young adventurers.  It is an enormous structure, composed of
marble, stone, and brick, and has been built upon a rocky hill.  The gates
are forged of wrought iron, and remain open to travelers of every size,
affiliation, and creed.  The central foyer of the School lies ahead, the
marble edifice looming over its well-worn gates.  A small courtyard opens
here, with a beautiful central fountain and a circle of low bushes.  

[Exits: north south]
     A beautiful golden fountain gushes water.

<205hp 140m 8mv> 
d
The Portal Chamber
  This cubical room is made from blocks of hewn marble.  Benches of similar
stone are set diagonally against the corners of the room, and an open
skylight provides illumination from above.  However, this room is unique in
that it contains four magical gateways which connect the School of Heroes to
various locations in Avendar.  Each glowing with soft blue light, the three
vertical portals are set into the eastern, western, and southern walls.  The
fourth portal is horizontal and circular, and is set into the floor directly
beneath the skylight.  A more mundane doorway leads north, to the courtyard
before the entrance to the School proper.  

[Exits: north east south west down]
(Translucent) A magic mouth hovers in mid-air, grinning nonchalantly.
The magic mouth tells you, 'Are you ready to travel the portals?'
The magic mouth tells you, 'Just say the name of the direction you want to go to learn more.'

The Entrance to the Tower of Testing
  Just north of the Adventurer's Lounge lies a connecting junction between
it and the Tower of Testing.  This dimly lit vestibule is made of rougher
hewn stone than the smooth bricks of the School proper, giving it a more
ominous air.  A hanging oil lantern which dangles from the ceiling only
enhances this mood, its unsteady light filling the room with trembling
shadows.  Engraved into the stone floor is the iconic sigil of the School of
Heroes, which serves as this chamber's only real ornamentation.  To the
north, the Tower awaits, the many sounds of its beasts echoing off of the
ancient stone walls.

A standing sign offers information to students.

The Beginning of the First Floor
  The Tower of Testing's first floor is a simple and rugged affair, built
of heavy, rough-hewn bricks.  Torches line the grey walls, and a chill
moisture clings to the air.  The floor underfoot is well-trod and packed
with rough mortar.  The first level of the Tower opens up into a low-lit,
open, and shadowy chamber.  There are no windows, and the dank air suggests
that this part is still below ground level.  The chamber continues to the
north, where the screeches of rats and the crackles of torches fill the
quiet air.

A Breezy Stairwell
  This stairwell is in the far northeast, just outside of the first floor
proper.  It is rugged and dark, lit with flickering torches.  However, as
the stairs climb higher, the chill cling of the air lessens and the basement
scent dims.  Warmer, fresher air travels downward on a faint breeze, causing
the flames to dance wildly atop their torches.  The steps are worn and
smooth, suggesting the passage of many feet.  To the south lies the
rat-infested first floor of the Tower of Testing, while the second floor
awaits above.

draping cloth-of-silver body wrap marks her as one of Ayaunj's

The Splendid Vault of Ayaunj
  This underground chamber is cool and dry relative to the open air of the
Gaaldic seaside.  No less exquisitely appointed than the upper floors, the
room is divided in half by a desk and wall of ornate silver bars, behind
which banking clerks count, sort, and exchange coins, transforming paper
into the precious metal so beloved by Ayaunj and Her priesthood.  Behind the
bustling clerks, the facade of both a vast vault and a guarded passage is
visible, secured by palpable auras of magic and divine power both.

Before the Gates of the School of Heroes
  Before you stand the gates of the School of Heroes, the renowned center
of training for young adventurers.  It is an enormous structure, composed of
marble, stone, and brick, and has been built upon a rocky hill.  The gates
are forged of wrought iron, and remain open to travelers of every size,
affiliation, and creed.  The central foyer of the School lies ahead, the
marble edifice looming over its well-worn gates.  A small courtyard opens
here, with a beautiful central fountain and a circle of low bushes.

<199hp 148m 16mv> 
The Portal Chamber
  This cubical room is made from blocks of hewn marble.  Benches of similar
stone are set diagonally against the corners of the room, and an open
skylight provides illumination from above.  However, this room is unique in
that it contains four magical gateways which connect the School of Heroes to
various locations in Avendar.  Each glowing with soft blue light, the three
vertical portals are set into the eastern, western, and southern walls.  The
fourth portal is horizontal and circular, and is set into the floor directly
beneath the skylight.  A more mundane doorway leads north, to the courtyard
before the entrance to the School proper.  

[Exits: north east south west down]

Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.

through the worst parts of town.  Built on the delta when Var Bandor was
founded, the northern buildings are the oldest, and consequently have become
the slum area.  Sadrent Road itself is a wide band of filthy cobblestones
winding between the ruined buildings.  To the east, Dretch street leads into
the most notorious neighborhoods of Var Bandor.  

[Exits: north east south]

<215hp 148m 34mv> 
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.

<215hp 148m 31mv> 
The Journey's End
  The Journey's End is a nice inn, though with closer examination you note
cobwebs that would not be present if this inn were in a more reputable part
of town.  A small bar stands in one corner, but most of the hard core
drinkers will go to one of the other numerous pubs along the road.  The
innkeeper stands behind the bar, accepting coin for his rooms upstairs, and
for food and drink alike.  The inn continues to the south, with more tables
for customers to sit down and relax, and there is a small door behind the
bar leading to the innkeeper's personal room.  North is the door back to the
bustle of Dantaron Road.

clothing of the citizens, and the meticulous maintenance of the streets.  To
the north is an elegant inn, and to the east is Ilrin Street.

<243hp 148m 60mv> 
Ilrin Street
  A wide street composed of black stones and carefully-arranged curbs,
Ilrin Street runs the length of southern Var Bandor, winding among the
gloriously rich houses of the merchants and the eccentrically constructed
towers of the scholars.  Here and there, baskets of flowers hang from the
sides of buildings, and hired servants tend to shaped shrubs.  The streets
in the southern part of town are swept clean, and all animal traffic is
prohibited.  To the east, Arcanos Street winds among the scholars' towers,
and to the west Commerce Street leads to the merchant quarter.

<243hp 148m 56mv> 
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.

Inside the Southern Gatehouse
  The southern gatehouse of Var Bandor is an elaborate affair,
well-maintained and proper.  A close watch is kept on the kind of traveler
allowed to enter the finest districts of the city, and a roster of those
banned from the area is kept nearby.  The immense granite walls rise to

The Forest Path
  A thin but well worn path winds through the forest of Nendor.  Stones

By the Ivy-Covered Gate Posts
  The old carriageway continues south, passing between a pair of old,

The Splendid Vault of Ayaunj
  This underground chamber is cool and dry relative to the open air of the
Gaaldic seaside.  No less exquisitely appointed than the upper floors, the
room is divided in half by a desk and wall of ornate silver bars, behind
which banking clerks count, sort, and exchange coins, transforming paper
into the precious metal so beloved by Ayaunj and Her priesthood.  Behind the
bustling clerks, the facade of both a vast vault and a guarded passage is
visible, secured by palpable auras of magic and divine power both.

The Foyer of the School of Heroes
  The School of Heroes begins with a grand foyer, complete with a vaulted
ceiling held aloft by great marble columns.  The room is spacious and airy,
with high, white marble walls and mounted, shining globes to provide light. 
Two great marble stairways sit back, just off center toward the room's north
side.  One ascends to an upper level of the School, and spirals about a
great glass pillar as it rises.  A well-made desk sits not far from the
foyer's entrance, giving the receptionist an opportunity to greet new
students.  The other descends to a lower level, and voices echo from its
depths.  Three halls open to the north, east, and west, leading to other
branches of the School.  The corridor to the south leads to the School's
iron gates.  

A large sign sits off to one side, offering directions to students.

The Adventurer's Lounge
  The lower level of the School of Heroes serves as a gathering place for
young adventurers, as well as an entry point to the Hall of Trials and Tower
of Testing.  This space, however, is known as the Adventurer's Lounge, which
is a large, open expanse.  It is filled with chairs, couches, and other
furniture, allowing students of the School to gather, converse, or join
together.  The walls are made older, darker stones than the floor above, but
are lit by similar iron sconces.  The floor is hardwood, rather than tile,
to dampen the clatter of steps.  The lounge continues to the north and east,
while the foyer of the School of Heroes is up a flight of marble stairs.  A
chamber lies to the south, home to the School's mascot.  

A sign stands near the stairwell.  

[Exits: north east south up]
A caladaran pupil ponders the meaning of one of his book's passages.

The Chamber of the Voice
  This small room is not far from the marble stairs which descend into the
Adventurer's Lounge.  Called the Chamber of the Voice, it houses one of the
School's most distinguished magical entities: the magic mouth.  Although its
origin is the subject of many rumors, it is both animate and aware.  It
chose this space for itself not long after the initial renovation of the
lounge, so it could be in close proximity to the School's center of
conversation.  The room itself is a simple affair, with matching hardwood
paneling and flooring.  Two potted plants sit near the rear of the room, one
in each corner, with a globe of light at the ceiling's center.  The
Adventurer's Lounge awaits to the north.  

A silver plaque is set into the wall, glittering enticingly.

<246hp 148m 116mv> The Bar in the Adventurer's Lounge
  The lower level of the School of Heroes serves as a gathering place for
young adventurers, as well as an entry point to the Hall of Trials and Tower
of Testing.  This space, however, is known as the Adventurer's Lounge, which
is a large, open expanse.  This corner of the lounge is arranged with chairs
and couches much like the rest, with a large, well-worn area rug in the
middle.  Notably, a well-polished bar stands against the south wall, and an
additional hallway leads to the east.  The lounge continues to the north and
west, its high, pale stones and well-lit accommodations inviting students to
linger.  Far to the north is the entrance to the Tower of Testing.  

A small sign sits on the end of the bar.

[Exits: north east west]
An aelin rogue stretches his wings, leaning against the bar.
(Targeted) A tall, outgoing alatharya woman polishes the bar.

<246hp 148m 116mv> You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Entrance to the Hall of Victors
  This spur off of the Adventurer's Lounge leads to a tremendous archway. 
It is particularly ancient, even for the School, and is marked by
now-unreadable druidic markings.  Whatever the original use for this
still-standing arch, the long-forgotten laborers who built the School used
it as a transition into another underground Hall.  Named the Hall of
Victors, it is designed to reward those who complete the School's many
trials.  The wooden floor of the west gives way to a rough-hewn stone not
altogether unlike the Tower of Testing, creating a regal but imposing
effect.  Two mounted globes of light illuminate the archway.  The Hall's
interior lies east, while the lounge is to the west.  

A small note is tacked to the archway.

[Exits: east west]
A grey-skinned giant blocks the eastern passage.
Shiguln tells you, 'You don't have the School brand.'
Shiguln tells you, 'Master says nobody enters the Hall of Victors without it.'

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Adventurer's Lounge
  The lower level of the School of Heroes serves as a gathering place for
young adventurers, as well as an entry point to the Hall of Trials and Tower
of Testing.  This space, however, is known as the Adventurer's Lounge, which
is a large, open expanse.  This corner of the lounge is a place for friends
to gather before entering the Tower of Testing, which trains young
adventurers in the ways of battle.  The dim echoes of its sounds filter back
into the lounge now and then, as a solemn reminder of how all students
eventually make their fortunes.  To the west and south, the lounge
continues.  Far to the west is the Hall of Trials and its training
exercises.  

An sign hangs upon the eastern wall.

[Exits: north south west]
A shuddeni student laments the choices of the teaching staff.

<246hp 148m 113mv>

<246hp 148m 113mv> 
n
The Entrance to the Tower of Testing
  Just north of the Adventurer's Lounge lies a connecting junction between
it and the Tower of Testing.  This dimly lit vestibule is made of rougher
hewn stone than the smooth bricks of the School proper, giving it a more
ominous air.  A hanging oil lantern which dangles from the ceiling only
enhances this mood, its unsteady light filling the room with trembling
shadows.  Engraved into the stone floor is the iconic sigil of the School of
Heroes, which serves as this chamber's only real ornamentation.  To the
north, the Tower awaits, the many sounds of its beasts echoing off of the
ancient stone walls.

A standing sign offers information to students.

[Exits: north south]

<246hp 148m 112mv> 
n
The Beginning of the First Floor
  The Tower of Testing's first floor is a simple and rugged affair, built
of heavy, rough-hewn bricks.  Torches line the grey walls, and a chill
moisture clings to the air.  The floor underfoot is well-trod and packed
with rough mortar.  The first level of the Tower opens up into a low-lit,
open, and shadowy chamber.  There are no windows, and the dank air suggests
that this part is still below ground level.  The chamber continues to the
north, where the screeches of rats and the crackles of torches fill the
quiet air.  

A sign is affixed to an iron stand.

[Exits: north south]
An oversized rat squeaks as it rolls onto its back.
An oversized rat runs swiftly through the shadows.
An oversized rat looks about on its hind legs, black eyes shining in the torchlight.
An oversized rat stretches out lazily on top of a broken stone.

The Adventurer's Lounge
  The lower level of the School of Heroes serves as a gathering place for
young adventurers, as well as an entry point to the Hall of Trials and Tower
of Testing.  This space, however, is known as the Adventurer's Lounge, which
is a large, open expanse.  This corner of the lounge includes a small,
burbling fountain to fill flasks or bottles before moving on to the School's
challenges.  The walls are made of older, darker stones than the floor
above, but are well-lit and smoothly cut.  A hallway leads to the west,
leading to the Chamber of the Voice and the Hall of Trials.  The lounge
itself continues to the south and east.  

A prominent bulletin board hangs from the northern wall.

<246hp 148m 128mv> 
The Adventurer's Lounge
  The lower level of the School of Heroes serves as a gathering place for
young adventurers, as well as an entry point to the Hall of Trials and Tower
of Testing.  This space, however, is known as the Adventurer's Lounge, which
is a large, open expanse.  It is filled with chairs, couches, and other
furniture, allowing students of the School to gather, converse, or join
together.  The walls are made older, darker stones than the floor above, but
are lit by similar iron sconces.  The floor is hardwood, rather than tile,
to dampen the clatter of steps.  The lounge continues to the north and east,
while the foyer of the School of Heroes is up a flight of marble stairs.  A
chamber lies to the south, home to the School's mascot.  

A sign stands near the stairwell.  

[Exits: north east south up]
A caladaran pupil ponders the meaning of one of his book's passages.

<246hp 148m 127mv> 
s
The Chamber of the Voice
  This small room is not far from the marble stairs which descend into the
Adventurer's Lounge.  Called the Chamber of the Voice, it houses one of the
School's most distinguished magical entities: the magic mouth.  Although its
origin is the subject of many rumors, it is both animate and aware.  It
chose this space for itself not long after the initial renovation of the
lounge, so it could be in close proximity to the School's center of
conversation.  The room itself is a simple affair, with matching hardwood
paneling and flooring.  Two potted plants sit near the rear of the room, one
in each corner, with a globe of light at the ceiling's center.  The
Adventurer's Lounge awaits to the north.  

A silver plaque is set into the wall, glittering enticingly.

[Exits: north]
(Translucent) A magic mouth hovers in mid-air, grinning nonchalantly.
The magic mouth says, 'Hi again, Rhuinzek.  Anything new since the last time we talked?'

You are promoted!!  You gain 22 hit points, 8 mana, and 8 movement.
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
A Rough-Hewn Stairwell
  To the west of the Adventurer's Lounge is a western alcove.  A set of
well-trodden stairs descend to a lower level and the beginning of the Hall of
Trials.  The alcove and the stairs it contains, much like other parts of the
School's lower facilities, are made of old, rough-hewn stone.  A hanging
banner informs students of where the stairs lead, and provides a splash of
color to an otherwise dark and grey passage.  Footsteps echo here, and the
cool air carries with it the musty scent of an ancient basement.  To the
east lies the inviting warmth of the lounge, while below await the School's
trials of the mind.  

[Exits: east down]

<246hp 148m 117mv> 
d
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Entrance to the Hall of Trials
  The entrance to the Hall of Trials is a gloomy affair, made from heavy
blocks of rough-hewn stone.  An old, echoing stairwell leads down to this
somber room, its wide steps worn with the passing of many ages.  Much like
the Tower of Testing, the Hall of Trials is lit with lonely oil lanterns,
casting the old stone with many shadows.  The air is cool and musty,
bringing with it the scents of old water and rich earth.  Through an archway
to the north lies the Hall proper, which contains many exercises to test new
students to the School of Heroes.  The stairwell leads upward into a small
alcove which leads back into the Adventurer's Lounge.  

A prominent sign is mounted to the wall at the bottom of the stairs.  

[Exits: north up]

<246hp 148m 116mv> 
n
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The Hall of Trials
  The Hall of Trials is intended to help students of the School of Heroes
to learn how to overcome basic obstacles and use universal techniques.  This
includes physical barriers, environmental conditions, and abilities
available to all adventurers.  The Hall is incredibly old, built of
rough-hewn blocks that have the musty scent of age.  The floor has been worn
smooth by generations of young adventurers walking upon it, but is generally
swept clean of debris.  At regular intervals along the ceiling are oil
lanterns, which cast shadows throughout.  To the west, a doorway leads to an
adjoining hallway.  

A plaque near the door reads, "The Test of Keys".

[Exits: north south west]

The Test of the Statue
  The room which houses the Test of the Statue is almost perfectly cubical,
walled with a series of rough-hewn blocks.  Unlike much of the Hall of
Trials, this room seems less ancient and more heavily trafficked.  Fully ten
feet on a side, the only notable feature of the room is a freestanding
pedestal at the room's center.  Atop the pedestal is a stone statue, carved
in the likeness of a stone gargoyle.  A lantern hanging from the ceiling
casts the room with fickle light.  The Hall of Trials lies to the west.

The Adventurer's Lounge
  The lower level of the School of Heroes serves as a gathering place for
young adventurers, as well as an entry point to the Hall of Trials and Tower
of Testing.  This space, however, is known as the Adventurer's Lounge, which
is a large, open expanse.  This corner of the lounge includes a small,
burbling fountain to fill flasks or bottles before moving on to the School's
challenges.  The walls are made of older, darker stones than the floor
above, but are well-lit and smoothly cut.  A hallway leads to the west,
leading to the Chamber of the Voice and the Hall of Trials.  The lounge
itself continues to the south and east.  

A prominent bulletin board hangs from the northern wall.

The Adventurer's Lounge
  The lower level of the School of Heroes serves as a gathering place for
young adventurers, as well as an entry point to the Hall of Trials and Tower
of Testing.  This space, however, is known as the Adventurer's Lounge, which

The Chamber of the Voice
  This small room is not far from the marble stairs which descend into the
Adventurer's Lounge.  Called the Chamber of the Voice, it houses one of the
School's most distinguished magical entities: the magic mouth.  Although its
origin is the subject of many rumors, it is both animate and aware.  It
chose this space for itself not long after the initial renovation of the
lounge, so it could be in close proximity to the School's center of
conversation.  The room itself is a simple affair, with matching hardwood
paneling and flooring.  Two potted plants sit near the rear of the room, one
in each corner, with a globe of light at the ceiling's center.  The
Adventurer's Lounge awaits to the north.

The Foyer of the School of Heroes
  The School of Heroes begins with a grand foyer, complete with a vaulted
ceiling held aloft by great marble columns.  The room is spacious and airy,
with high, white marble walls and mounted, shining globes to provide light. 
Two great marble stairways sit back, just off center toward the room's north
side.  One ascends to an upper level of the School, and spirals about a
great glass pillar as it rises.  A well-made desk sits not far from the
foyer's entrance, giving the receptionist an opportunity to greet new
students.  The other descends to a lower level, and voices echo from its
depths.  Three halls open to the north, east, and west, leading to other
branches of the School.  The corridor to the south leads to the School's
iron gates.  

A large sign sits off to one side, offering directions to students.

[Exits: north east south west up down]
(?) A mossy-haired caladaran woman sits at the reception desk.

Before the Gates of the School of Heroes
  Before you stand the gates of the School of Heroes, the renowned center
of training for young adventurers.  It is an enormous structure, composed of
marble, stone, and brick, and has been built upon a rocky hill.  The gates
are forged of wrought iron, and remain open to travelers of every size,

marble edifice looming over its well-worn gates.  A small courtyard opens

<249hp 151m 108mv> 
s
The Portal Chamber
  This cubical room is made from blocks of hewn marble.  Benches of similar
stone are set diagonally against the corners of the room, and an open
skylight provides illumination from above.  However, this room is unique in
that it contains four magical gateways which connect the School of Heroes to
various locations in Avendar.  Each glowing with soft blue light, the three
vertical portals are set into the eastern, western, and southern walls.  The
fourth portal is horizontal and circular, and is set into the floor directly
beneath the skylight.  A more mundane doorway leads north, to the courtyard
before the entrance to the School proper.  

[Exits: north east south west down]

The magic mouth tells you, 'Are you ready to travel the portals?'
The magic mouth tells you, 'Just say the name of the direction you want to go to learn more.'

East Qalnistra Street
  This street runs east and west through Old Earendam, cutting a precise
line through the buildings and side streets which line the way.  Paved with

<253hp 154m 95mv> 
End of Qalnistra Street
  Qalnistra Street's western extent comes to an end here, halting in the
Earendam's colossal temple of Jolinn.  Marbles steps lead up, and to the
west, passing underneath pillars which are easily thirty paces high. 
Meticulously carved and cared for, the temple is devoid of the gold and
silver ornaments found in temples to other gods, but in the frieze above the
entranceway, the characters of the bas relief are lined with diamond, and
the center depicts the sapphire spear, symbolically represented by an
enormous sapphire.  

[Exits: east west]

<253hp 154m 94mv> 
Inside a Temple to Jolinn
  The interior of Earendam's temple to Jolinn is daunting in its size. 
Topped by a dome of bluish marble, the room is illuminated by the glass
oculus that breaks the surface of the roof.  Light reflects on the carved
mosaic in the floor, which depicts the precepts of Jolinn in shades of
sapphire and inlaid mother-of-pearl.  A rival even to Iandir's prevalent
religion in this city, Jolinn's temple is tended by an ancient group of
clergymen, and maintained by the city's wealthier patrons.  To the west, an
altar is set upon an illuminated dais, while alcoves lead north and south
out of this massive chamber.  

[Exits: north east south down]
(White Aura) Falcia Nilin attends to the altar of Jolinn.

liberation of Var Bandor, set before a wide, heavy desk.  The environment
feels almost sterile, both imposing and inescapable despite the large double
doors perpetually open to Dantaron street.

s
The Journey's End
  The Journey's End is a nice inn, though with closer examination you note
cobwebs that would not be present if this inn were in a more reputable part
of town.  A small bar stands in one corner, but most of the hard core
drinkers will go to one of the other numerous pubs along the road.  The
innkeeper stands behind the bar, accepting coin for his rooms upstairs, and
for food and drink alike.  The inn continues to the south, with more tables
for customers to sit down and relax, and there is a small door behind the
bar leading to the innkeeper's personal room.  North is the door back to the
bustle of Dantaron Road.  

[Exits: north (east) south]

A woman sits here, enjoying the peace of the inn.
A patron of the inn sits here, enjoying a fine meal.
A young boy sits here, spinning a brightly coloured top.

<268hp 156m 123mv> 
e
Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A bedraggled orange tabby cat with a tattered ear and a mournful expression is here.
     A large marble fountain gurgles peacefully here.
A grey pigeon walks about tentatively, looking for scraps of food.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.

<268hp 156m 122mv> Sadrent Road
  Sadrent Road runs the length of northern Var Bandor, winding its way
through the worst parts of town.  Built on the delta when Var Bandor was
founded, the northern buildings are the oldest, and consequently have become
the slum area.  Sadrent Road itself is a wide band of filthy cobblestones
winding between the ruined buildings.  To the south is the central square of
Var Bandor.

All You Knead Bakery
  Two entrances lead into this corner bakery, from Sadrent Road on the west
and Dretch Street to the north.  Many-paned windows on each wall allow
natural light, providing a view of the streets through the bubbled glass.  A
seat is built under the western window, with room for two.  A few brightly
painted tables occupy the space, notably a long magenta table and a round
teal table.  The walls are a soft, inviting yellow and decorated with local
art.  A large counter displays a plethora of baked goods and supports a
heavy, steaming apparatus.  Further in, an oven is kept warm and the bakery
shelves stocked.  A staircase leads up to a private apartment.  

[Exits: north west (up)]
     A hastily-painted sign sits on the counter.
In the back, Nupane rolls out some dough.
A tattooed alatharya, Tefory, works the coffee apparatus.

founded, the northern buildings are the oldest, and consequently have become
the slum area.  Sadrent Road itself is a wide band of filthy cobblestones
winding between the ruined buildings.

<268hp 156m 159mv> Center Square
  A burbling fountain dominates the center of the square.  The fountain is
made of gray marble veined with blue.  Large sculptures of dancing otters
and leaping trout, gazing skyward and spouting water from their mouths, sit
within the circular basin.  The rim of the basin appears designed for
seating, but is sprinkled with water.  The square is mortared with rounded
cobblestone radiating outwards from the fountain.  The sounds and smells of
the market and other popular locales nearby mingle in the air.  

[Exits: north east south west]
     A bedraggled orange tabby cat with a tattered ear and a mournful expression is here.

An armed enforcer of Var Bandor stands here.

<268hp 156m 158mv> 
Aragol Street
  Aragol Street bisects the east half of Var Bandor, leading from Center
Square to the docks outside the eastern gatehouse.  Sailors and dockmen
abound in this section of the city, wandering the streets while off-duty. 
The street is composed of well-worn cobblestones, with a few broken and
missing.  To the west is Center Square.  

[Exits: east west]

through the worst parts of town.  Built on the delta when Var Bandor was
founded, the northern buildings are the oldest, and consequently have become

e
Raddin Street
  Raddin Street, named after an ancient hero from the War of Fire, wends
its way east and west through Var Bandor.  Once a thriving part of town
known for its reputation as a home for men of action, it now serves as the
stomping ground for Var Bandor's cheaper hired swords.  A carved shield
marks the door of an armory to the north, while a hanging sign emblazoned
with a sword calls attention to the weapon shop to the south.  Raddin street
continues to the east, while the main drag of Sadrent road opens to the
west.

The Wench's Lute
  This shop lies just off of the east end of Raddin Street, and is exactly
as dingy as one might expect for the surroundings.  One of the windows is
boarded over, and the other is made of bubbled, foggy glass.  An imitation
Harrudim rug covers most of the uneven floor, and a roughly made counter is
toward the east side of the room.  Instruments are mounted on the walls

doorway leads west.

A Run-Down Weaponry
  This small store is particularly cramped and showing of age.  The ceiling
is cracked across the center, and the paint and plaster look aged and in
some need of repair.  Despite this, examples of the shop's unusual wares
hang along the walls on display, made primarily of wood and iron.  Weapons
of all types are arrayed throughout the shop, leaning or mounted.  The floor
is worn and rickety, and the shop's main counter is battered and worn from
years of sales.  Smaller work can be done in a small kiln in the back room,
but that seems more for repairs or modifications than to create the massive
wares the shop sells.  Raddin Street lies through the door to the north.  

[Exits: north]
A grizzled, scarred alatharya works within the shop.

The Saurian Armory
  This armory is unusually hot, presumably both because of the kiln against
the shop's north wall, and because of the tastes of its clientele.  An anvil
sits prominently near it, with a variety of tools stewn haphazardly about
the room.  Examples of the shop's unique wares hang from the walls, the
mounted skull-masks and intricately carved metal plates leering from the
aging walls.  Various hide and bone fetishes serve as the room's only other
apparent decorations, giving the entire affair a far more barbarous feel. 
The floor is marked by small scorches, where still-hot metal made a lasting
impression upon it.  To the south is Raddin Street, and the far cooler air
of the city.  

[Exits: south]
A huge, red-scaled srryn blacksmith tends his shop.

Iron Street
  Iron street is in a working class part of Var Bandor, and is far from
being one of the nicer areas in the city.  Men walk about along the street
going about their business, and few seem to notice you here.  Some small,
cramped houses line the streets between the larger warehouses, and some
children wearing ragged clothes can be seen playing outdoors.  The people
here do not seem as happy as those in the nicer parts of the city--a faint
air of oppression hangs over the working class folk of Iron Street.  To the
east is Sadrent Road.  

[Exits: east (south) west]
An armed enforcer of Var Bandor patrols here.

the slum area.  Sadrent Road itself is a wide band of filthy cobblestones
winding between the ruined buildings.  To the west, Iron Street leads into
the industrial section of Var Bandor, and to the east, Raddin street winds
through some run-down buildings.

Inside the Northern Gatehouse
  This gatehouse house is built behind the gates of Sadrent, the oldest of
the gates into Var Bandor.  Outside, to the north, a ferry leads across the
Dantaron river, while to the south Sadrent road snakes its way into the
city.  The gatehouse is ill-tended, leading in to the poorest section of the
city, and consequently little attention is paid to the traffic of riff-raff
and n'er-do-wells through these wrought iron gates.

The Earendam Road

still nominally maintained by Earendam.

The North Gates of Earendam
  Earendam's north gates are forged from black iron, built between the
stone walls of the city.  Reinforced by stout iron bars, the gates are built
thick, for increased security.  Outside the gates lie the expanse of the
northern grasslands, across which runs the Earendam road, which leads all
the way to the Brintors.  Inside, Tyril Square marks the beginning of
Earendam proper.

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
North of Tyril Square
  The north part of Tyril square lies very near the gates of Earendam,
which lie to the north.  Past the gates are grasslands, and eventually the
Brintor mountains, which provide most of the source of Earendam's mineral
wealth and its building materials.  The gate is mainly used by Brintorean
miners, traders, or the occasionally diplomatic party from Kor Thrandir. 
East and west, the corners of the square end in arched buildings, while a
central fountain dominates the square to the south.  

[Exits: north east south west]
A city watchman patrols the streets of Earendam.

<268hp 156m 178mv> 
s
You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
Center of Tyril Square
  The center of Tyril square is dominated by a marble statue, serving as
the centerpiece for a concentric series of fountains.  Serving as the
junction for travel between Earendam's north gate, the mercantile quarter,
the artisan's district, and the occasional nobleman from Old Earendam across
the Dantaron, the square is nevertheless well-maintained, and covered with a
glazed brown cobblestone of Brintorean stone.  The main throughfares of the
square are Frinian Way, which intersects the square in the east and picks
up again in the west, and Tyril Way, which opens onto the square to the
south.  

[Exits: north east south west]
Corporal Landilus patrols the city, watchful for any sign of trouble.
A muscular protector is loitering here, surveying the area casually.

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
East of Tyril Square
  The east of Tyril Square is covered with a smooth cobblestone of glazed
brown bricks.  Near the north gate of Earendam, Tyril Square is filled with
the traffic of artisans and scholars who inhabit this part of the city.  The
center of the square is west, where a marble statue rises out of the silver
base of a large fountain.  South and north are the edges of the square,
where scholars have set up shop to ply the wares of some of Avendar's most
famous magicks.  To the east Frinian Way heads into the heart of the
artisan's quarter, where scholars and craftsman come to learn and ply their
trade.

East Frinian Way
  East Frinian Way begins here, serving as a throughway for the scholars
and craftsman who travel to and from Tyril Square to the west and the
artisan's district of Earendam further east.  To the south of the street,
marble stairs lead up to enter some sort of scholar's shop, while the
building to the north is less ostentatious, being a simple stone block
guarded by gate archways.  Home to the Company of the Ram, the building
houses one of Earendam's chartered mercenary companies.

East Frinian Way
  East Frinian Way heads in a straight east-west line through Earendam's
artisan's district.  Lining the street are shops bearing the products of the

continues much the same to both the east and west.

Vandar's Blades
  Vandar's Blades is a well-furnished shop, offering the wares created by
the craftsman who inhabit the artisan's district of Earendam.  With no forge
in evidence, the shop is remarkably comfortable, offering a wide variety of
weapons on display on the walls behind the counter that takes up the north
half of the room.  The wall to the east is rather thin, and is broken by a
pine door.  A doorway also leads southward onto Frinian Way, which runs in
past the front of the shop.

Elrith's Armory
  Elrith's Armory specializes in the fine plate armors produced by the
artisans and earth scholars of Earendam, providing wares for the cities
wealthier nobility.  With most of the merchandise furnished by the artisans
in the surrounding parts of the city, the shop lacks the forge common in

leads through a wall to the west, and the way onto the street lies south.

The Earendam Docks
  A wide wooden docks has been erected just to the north of the River
Dantaron, flowing sluggishly to the south under the city wall.  The docks
are clear of clutter, incoming cargo being regulated closely and required to
move immediately.  An occasional raft or barge can be seen on the river,
arriving or leaving the city.  To the east, the granite walls of Earendam
tower above the dock area.  Several ladders and wooden walkways lead
downward to the water of the river itself.

  A well-worn dirt path has been beaten into the soil outside the southern
gatehouse of Earendam.  Known as the Southern Path, the trail leads south of

tower, and to the east and west are the outskirts of Earendam.

Thynseus' Apothecary
  The walls and architecture of this establishment are typical of
Earendam, but the contents are a substantial departure from the norm. 
Exotic flora fills the chamber, growing from pots or troughs, and even
creeping up the walls.  Vividly colored flowers bloom from delicate pots,
and clinging vines border the walls of the room.  The air is preternaturally
warm, and is filled with smells of damp humus.  A covered archway leads
south to the street, and a maple-wood door opens to the east.

The reptilian Thynseus tends to his plants.

<268hp 156m 142mv>

The Dantaron Vault
  The Dantaron Vault is one of Earendam's leading banks, claiming a
thousand year history and a magically impenetrable vault to hide the
valuables of its owners.  Its furnishings are as lavish as its reputation
suggests: plush couches provide seating for the bank's patrons, and the
attendants work from behind gilded bars.  The bank's primary exit lies
through an archway to the south.  

[Exits: south]
A city watchman patrols the streets of Earendam.

  A wide wooden docks has been erected just to the north of the River

are clear of clutter, incoming cargo being regulated closely and required to

Western Outskirts of Earendam
  Beyond the bare ground of the city walls begin the Grasslands of
Earendam, a vast sea of green vegetation that stirs and whispers softly in
the breeze.  The long Earendam grasses grow to your waist, and so densely as
to slow progress through the area.  The walls of the city Earendam are
visible nearby to the east.  To the south the Arien Road cuts through the
grass.

The Portal Chamber
  This cubical room is made from blocks of hewn marble.  Benches of similar
stone are set diagonally against the corners of the room, and an open
skylight provides illumination from above.  However, this room is unique in
that it contains four magical gateways which connect the School of Heroes to
various locations in Avendar.  Each glowing with soft blue light, the three
vertical portals are set into the eastern, western, and southern walls.  The
fourth portal is horizontal and circular, and is set into the floor directly
beneath the skylight.  A more mundane doorway leads north, to the courtyard
before the entrance to the School proper.

The Temple of Balance
  An ancient temple, this place is built in a magnificent style, calling to

Center of Tyril Square
  The center of Tyril square is dominated by a marble statue, serving as
the centerpiece for a concentric series of fountains.  Serving as the
junction for travel between Earendam's north gate, the mercantile quarter,
the artisan's district, and the occasional nobleman from Old Earendam across
the Dantaron, the square is nevertheless well-maintained, and covered with a
glazed brown cobblestone of Brintorean stone.  The main throughfares of the
square are Frinian Way, which intersects the square in the east and picks
up again in the west, and Tyril Way, which opens onto the square to the
south.

Southeast of Tyril Square
  The southeast corner of Tyril Square is a popular gathering spot for
scholars, nestled as it is between the sides of two of the city's most
renowned storehouses of arcana.  Both buildings lie to the south and east,
and both are constructed in the manner of the grand Republican style --
Brintor marble stairs lead up above street level to pass through ornate
columns into the respective stores, both trying their best to dominate their
immediate environs.  The square opens in streets both north and west of
here, while a central fountain lies northwest.  An ornate marble marker with
inscribed writing here lies between the two shops, identifying features of
each.

s
The Portal Chamber
  This cubical room is made from blocks of hewn marble.  Benches of similar
stone are set diagonally against the corners of the room, and an open
skylight provides illumination from above.  However, this room is unique in
that it contains four magical gateways which connect the School of Heroes to
various locations in Avendar.  Each glowing with soft blue light, the three
vertical portals are set into the eastern, western, and southern walls.  The
fourth portal is horizontal and circular, and is set into the floor directly
beneath the skylight.  A more mundane doorway leads north, to the courtyard
before the entrance to the School proper.  

[Exits: north east south west down]

The Entrance to the Tower of Testing
  Just north of the Adventurer's Lounge lies a connecting junction between

The Beginning of the Third Floor
  The third floor of the Tower of Testing is a stone and tile affair, much
like the School of Heroes.  The bricks are white and lit by lanterns which
hang from the ceiling, as well as the large glass windows which look out
into the surrounding skyscape.  The tiles are dark and well-trod, showing
the scuffs of many young adventurers.  The air on this floor is surprisingly
clear and fresh due to better ventilation; however, it still stings the nose
with the acrid scent of summoning.  Scratches and the spattering of dark
blood mar the floor, ceiling and walls, with the high screech of imps never

The West Side of the Third Floor
  The third floor of the Tower of Testing is a stone and tile affair, much
like the School of Heroes.  The bricks are white and lit by lanterns which
hang from the ceiling, as well as the large glass windows which look out
into the surrounding skyscape.  The tiles are dark and well-trod, showing
the scuffs of many young adventurers.  The air on this floor is surprisingly
clear and fresh due to better ventilation; however, it still stings the nose
with the acrid scent of summoning.  Scratches and the spattering of dark
blood mar the floor, ceiling and walls, with the high screech of imps never
far from the ear.  The hall continues to the north and south.

<290hp 166m 188mv> A Glass Stairwell
  The glass stairwell leads upward to the third floor of the Tower of
Testing.  The tower itself begins a transition away from the rough-hewn
stone of the lower levels toward white brick and tile, much like that of the
School of Heroes.  The ceilings are substantially higher than the floor
below, with high glass panels that follow the stairs as they proceed further
up.  From here you have a pleasant but commanding view of Avendar's distant
horizons, with vents letting in further fresh air from above.  The stairway
gets colder as it descends.  

A standing sign describes the trials of this floor.

[Exits: north down]

You gained 1 exploration point and 50 experience points!
The End of the Third Floor
  The third floor of the Tower of Testing is a stone and tile affair, much
like the School of Heroes.  The bricks are white and lit by lanterns which
hang from the ceiling, as well as the large glass windows which look out
into the surrounding skyscape.  The tiles are dark and well-trod, showing
the scuffs of many young adventurers.  The air on this floor is surprisingly
clear and fresh due to better ventilation however, it still stings the nose
with the acrid scent of summoning.  Scratches and the spattering of dark
blood mar the floor, ceiling and walls, with the high screech of imps never
far from the ear.  To the south, a marble stairwell ascends to the fourth
floor, while the hall continues to the north.

A Marble Stairwell
  A marble stairwell leads upward to the fourth floor of the Tower of
Testing.  The white stones of the third level end at the entrance to this
stairwell, instead replaced by the iconic marble of the School's main level.
The tile floor looks less worn and of a higher sheen, and the stairwell
itself is polished to a high gloss.  Arched windows look out onto the world
at large, high enough to give the faint of heart a bit of pause.  The sounds
of battle ring out from the floor above.  The long hall of the third floor
lies to the north.

A Marble Stairwell
  A marble stairwell ends at the doorstep of the fourth floor of the Tower
of Testing.  This entire floor is done in the polished black tile of the
School of Heroes proper, and the walls are a high, glossy marble.  The
chamber which composes the fourth floor is the largest and most open yet,
the great expanse of its floor composing a patterned relief of the School's
iconic sigil.  The air is cool but smelling of exertion, blood, and metal. 
Lanterns hang from the ceiling to illuminate the final steps before entering
the floor.  Down the stairs, the third floor awaits.  

A plaque is inset into the wall at the top of the stairs.

The Southwest Corner of the Fourth Floor
  This floor of the Tower of Testing is done in polished black tile, with
walls of high marble.  The ceiling is vaulted and extravagant, the entire
expanse forming a wide open battle arena.  The tiles of the floor compose a
patterned relief of the iconic sigil of the School of Heroes.  The air is
cool but smells of exertion, blood, and spellcraft.  Lanterns hang from the
high ceiling, lighting the chamber at night, while natural light filters in
through arched windows during the day.  A stairwell leads down to the third
floor to the west, while the chamber continues north and east.
